items.title:
Lauren Duffus
        –
        Can's Gone Warm
items.label: Select Few
items.description:
Select Few
      
        Lauren Duffus
        –
        Can's Gone Warm
      
      
        These six tracks are a brilliant melange of trip-hop, grime, R&B and
        guitar music. "Super" shows off clicky percussion and icy synths,
        springing around the South London artist's reverbed falsetto in a way
        that recalls Fade to Mind-era Kelela. The vocal hook of "N.U.M.T.E.,"
        another clear highlight, channels the serpentine sensuality of '90s R&B
        before diving into ricocheting jungle.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

BAMBII –
        INFINITY CLUB II
items.label: Because Music
items.description:
Because Music
      
        BAMBII –
        INFINITY CLUB II
      
      
        Arriving two years after the first, BAMBII's second volume of
        INFINITY CLUB takes us all around the Caribbean with a
        star-studded roster of vocalists. "NSYNC," featuring Skrillex
        collaborator BEAM, is dancehall with a '00s twist. Brazilian artist
        LYZZA brings baile funk to "Blue Sky." And "Mirror," with Jessy Lanza
        and Yaeji, explores guitar-led pop amid outbursts of jungle.
      
      
        Listen:

bastiengoat
        –
        Liquor Store Lime
items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Self-released
      
        bastiengoat
        –
        Liquor Store Lime
      
      
        How many times can 50 Cent's "In Da Club" be reworked for peak time?
        bastiengoat's "Home Burden" makes a damn good case for it. Once the
        reflective piano chords come in, you're reminded how the Bay Area

items.title:
Surusinghe –
        i can't remember the name of this, but that's ok
items.label: dh2
items.description:
dh2
      
        Surusinghe –
        i can't remember the name of this, but that's ok
      
      
        Surusinghe's dynamic, percussive tunes instantly teleport you to a
        strobe-lit dance floor. With a short, chipmunk sample looped over synths
        that sound like rubber bands, "FTRW!" is the kind of track that lights
        up festival stages. "Wolfgang" is similarly energetic. As a tunnelling
        loop bubbles up at lightning speed, techno kicks transport the cut to
        the dark, shadowy corners of the club.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title: The Wednesday Alternative Mix
items.description:
FFAN

      
        The Wednesday Alternative Mix
      
      
        Look for an apt description of FFAN's style, and "adult-oriented disco"
        might fit best. It was originally coined to
        describe
        the music of Prins Thomas, whose tracks appear in this high-energy hour
        of The Ransom Note's Wednesday Alternative Mix series. The term feels
        just right for the Nyapi owner's eclectic sound. Across the hour-long
        mix, the Seoul-based DJ maintains a medium tempo, blending dark,
        flamboyant elements—from gothic synths and vocals to acid flourishes and
        suspense-filled drum arrangements.

items.title: Oceanic at Garage, Horst Arts & Music 2025
items.description:
Oceanic

      
        Oceanic at Garage, Horst Arts & Music 2025
      
      
        One of the most memorable sets at this year's Horst Arts & Music wasn't
        on the festival's main stage, but its most intimate. In a low-lit corner
        of Garage, Oceanic delved into the wonky side of house music—strange
        vocals, minimal classics and beatless synth workouts. Featuring Laurie
        Spiegel and Skee Mask, the two-and-a-half-hour recording is melodic and
        weightless in parts, heavy and heady in others—but consistently
        elevating.

items.title: GYSTMIX-030
items.description:
Gay Felony

      
        GYSTMIX-030
      
      
        Gay Felony is the alias of Melody Scallion, a longtime force in LA's
        dance music underground. Her sets, like this one for the increasingly
        essential Gyration Station series, are deliberately fast and ecstatic,
        moving through upbeat house selections that wouldn't be out of place in
        an Eris Drew and Octo Octa set. It's an intentional choice to queer the
        floor, collapse binaries and dive headfirst into transfuturism.

items.title: Everything reminds me of dubstep pt. III - curated by livwutang
items.description:
livwutang,
      Beatrice M.

      
        Everything reminds me of dubstep pt. III - curated by livwutang
      
      
        Everything reminds me of dubstep is a series that reimagines the UK-born
        genre through its softest moments—the bridges, outros and tender
        undercurrents. For the third instalment, New York-based DJ (and former
        Resident Advisor staffer) livwutang curates a playlist which
        Beatrice M. then assembled into a mix that foregrounds lush, sweeping
        melodies and emotional density. It's a love letter to the genre's
        range—a reminder that dubstep has always been just as much about feeling
        as force.

items.title: ITPS117
items.description:
Commodo

      
        ITPS117
      
      
        Commodo's entry into the Ilian Tape podcast vault spotlights the darker
        fringes of bass music. Featuring TRG's "Broken Heart," Rene Wise's
        "Don't Care" and Mala's "Tombstone," his selections are simply bananas,
        running the gamut from techno rippers to dubstep classics and back. He
        includes several of his own productions—most notably, "Shake and Lurk"
        and "89! Gloom!" from a new EP with Gantz—alongside standout picks from
        artists like TMSV, Hijinx and Kuedo.
      
    
        Commodo's entry into the Ilian Tape podcast vault spotlights the darker
        fringes of bass music. Featuring TRG's "Broken Heart," Rene Wise's
        "Don't Care" and Mala's "Tombstone," his selections are simply bananas,
        running the gamut from techno rippers to dubstep classics and back. He
        includes several of his own productions—most notably, "Shake and Lurk"
        and "89! Gloom!" from a new EP with Gantz—alongside standout picks from
        artists like TMSV, Hijinx and Kuedo.

items.title: Rio 015 - Adi (recorded live at Bonanza 2025)
items.description:
Adi

      
        Rio 015 - Adi (recorded live at Bonanza 2025)
      
      
        Set in the lush surroundings of Buritaca, Colombia, Bonanza Festival has
        quietly become a key meeting point for Latin America's electronic
        community. Adi, born in Bogotá and now based in Brussels, has built a
        steady following for her blends of trippy house, electro and techno,
        tinged with acid. Taking over from Nicolas Lutz at 7:30 AM, she kept up
        the momentum with nimble rhythms and just the right amount of sleaze,
        squelch and restraint.

items.title: IT.podcast.s14e04: BMG at No Way Back 2025
items.description:
BMG

      
        IT.podcast.s14e04: BMG at No Way Back 2025
      
      
        If Detroit's Movement Festival is a pilgrimage, then No Way Back is its
        sacred ritual. The annual Tangent Gallery gathering is special for
        everyone involved, chiefly the DJs, who always go the extra mile. Motor
        City legend BMG is no exception. This year, he debuted fresh hardware
        remasters and exclusive edits of Pink Floyd, 808 State and Aphex Twin,
        alongside forthcoming releases on Interdimensional Transmissions. As he
        said himself: "We start at the Tangent and end up travelling to the
        other side of the universe."

items.title: Deep House, Electronic & Broken Beats on a Tuktuk
items.label: Pam Anantr
items.description:
Pam Anantr
      
      
        Deep House, Electronic & Broken Beats on a Tuktuk
      
      
        On Bangkok's TukTuk Radio, DJs play CDJs while cruising around the Thai
        metropolis on a tuk-tuk. The latest episode features Pam Anantr, a
        staple of the local club scene and cofounder of
        Salon Kiku. For a captivating hour, she indulges in broken drums from the likes
        of Mia Koden, plus jazzy house à la Paul Johnson and Pal Joey.

Planet Mu

      
        Various –
        Planet Mu 30
      
      
        The influential UK label marks 30 years with a typically eclectic,

Erika de Casier
        –
        Lifetime
items.label: Independent Jeep Music
items.description:
Independent Jeep Music

      
        Erika de Casier
        –
        Lifetime
      
      
        The alt-R&B artist's fourth album crystallises her tastemaking without
        ever sacrificing style for substance. Written and produced entirely on
        her own, Lifetime is a confidently self-referential record that
        goes with her own flow, settling into sensual downtempo that somehow
        manages to sound both effortless and studied.

items.label: Smalltown Supersound

Smalltown Supersound

      
        Kara-Lis Coverdale
        –
        From Where You Came
      
      
        Kara-Lis Coverdale's first album in eight years draws heavily from
        programmatic music, a classical style that gained traction in the

PinkPantheress
        –
        Fancy That
items.label: Warner Records
items.description:
Warner Records

      
        PinkPantheress
        –
        Fancy That
      
      
        Fancy That is a cheeky romp through UK dance pop history, sipping
        from everything on the Y2K singles charts—from the digital glut of
        Spiceworld to the trance vortexes of Frankfurt producer Spicelab.
        Colours get dialled up to maximum saturation as PinkPantheress splashes
        into full-hearted, unguarded pop for the first time.

items.title:
Model/Actriz –
        Pirouette
items.label: True Panther Sounds
items.description:
True Panther Sounds

      
        Model/Actriz –
        Pirouette
      
      
        Casting aside their previously hard-edged bravado, New York band
        Model/Actriz embrace vulnerability with confidence and a newfound
        lightness on Pirouette. They've dubbed it a dance pop album,
        manually aping drum machines and introducing earworm hooks. The LP still
        has the band's no wave dissonance and twisted bacchanalian throb, but
        some seriously operatic vocal moments demonstrate a real willingness to
        take the armour off.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

Surgeon –

items.label: Tresor
items.description:
Tresor

      
        Surgeon –
        Shell~Wave
      
      
        What does techno mean to a 30-year-plus stalwart of the sound? For
        Surgeon, it's a spiritual collaboration between humans and technology,
        past and future. Shell~Wave bottles his personal experiences with
        his machines and delivers it to listeners with the improvisation of a
        free jazz musician.

Soundway Records

        Lucia's Dennery segment and Dominica's bouyon—dissected to a clinical

Shanti Celeste

        Romance
items.label: Method 808
items.description:
Method 808

      
        Shanti Celeste
        –
        Romance
      
      
        "Can we get closer?" So asks Shanti Celeste over a shimmery
        bassline on "Unwind." On her second album, the British-Chilean producer
        puts her vocals front and centre for the first time, fusing garage, R&B
        and her signature house with a disarming sense of intimacy, both on and
        off the dance floor.

items.title:
OSSX –
        WORLD KEEPS TURNING
items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Self-released

      
        OSSX –
        WORLD KEEPS TURNING
      
      
        Prolific New Jersey trio OSSX are keenly attuned to the needs of the
        dance floor. Their debut album wholeheartedly bolsters this reputation,
        spreading their signature East Coast club sound—hollering vocals,
        shuttling snares—over samples of '90s hits that almost seem too obvious
        (look out for Suzanne Vega's "Tom's Diner," Cheryl Lynn's "Got to Be
        Real"). But in OSSX's hands, pop and R&B become club tools that any
        smart DJ will keep in their kit.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Smerz –
        Big city life
items.label: ESCHO
items.description:
ESCHO

      
        Smerz –
        Big city life
      
      
        On Big city life, Smerz finds a cohesive sound that elevates
        their place in the Norwegian experimental scene. By leaning into
        guitars, hook-driven R&B and low-slung electro, they've strengthened
        their storytelling chops (as on the string-led "Feisty" and the romance
        of "You got time and I got money") while keeping their loveable knack
        for weirdness.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
J. Albert –
        Return To Sender
items.label: Self-Released
items.description:
Self-Released

      
        J. Albert –
        Return To Sender
      
      
        New York producer J. Albert returns with his first proper album in
        years. The focus? Stoner ambient and dub techno. "Warped Mirror" offers
        glimpses of his lo-fi house past with deep house chords and brittle dub
        architecture. "22" cuts through the vibey feel, descending into an
        industrial ambient abyss where synths snap and hiss like high-voltage
        power lines. One to sink into.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

Ron Trent
        –
        Lift Off
items.label: Rush Hour Music
items.description:
Rush Hour Music

      
        Ron Trent
        –
        Lift Off
      
      
        Ron Trent's first album since
        2022 builds on the smooth,
        jazzy house that he's so loved for. Centreing bright synth lines and
        cruising funk tempos, Lift Off slowly dials up the energy levels,
        all while maintaining the Chicago legend's signature sultry cool.

items.title:
Anthony Naples
        –
        Scanners
items.label: ANS Recordings
items.description:
ANS Recordings

      
        Anthony Naples
        –
        Scanners
      
      
        There's plenty to marvel at on Anthony Naples' sixth album,
        Scanners. "Lifetimes" has an R&B feel to its gilded chords and an
        East Coast shuffle to its booming drums. "Bounce" is slick, tunnelling
        techno. "Somebody"'s stuttering, detuned piano notes slip intricately in
        and out of a punchy four-to-the-floor beat. The rhythms are tight and
        addictive from the start, the melodies keeping you tethered to the
        endless groove.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Colombian Drone Mafia, Gibrana Cervantes –
        Memoria
items.label: Ambie—Tón
items.description:
Ambie—Tón

      
        Colombian Drone Mafia, Gibrana Cervantes –
        Memoria
      
      
        TraTraTrax cofounder Nyksan is next up on ambient sub-label, Ambie—Tón.
        Under a new alias, Colombian Drone Mafia, the Bogotá producer works with
        Mexican violinist Gibrana Cervantes to create 3D worlds. Ambient waves
        recede into clattering noise; nocturnal insect chirps are countered by
        the hum of a traffic jam. Even in the darkest passages, there's a
        suspended sense of hope.
      
      Read the full review

        Bandcamp

items.title:
Stereolab
        –
        Instant Holograms On Metal Film
items.label: Warp Records
items.description:
Warp Records

      
        Stereolab
        –
        Instant Holograms On Metal Film
      
      
        16 years after Stereolab went on hiatus, the avant-pop band make a
        triumphant return. The hooks are grander, the beats are louder and their
        typically progressive lyrics are sharper than ever. "Melodie Is A Wound"
        includes a screeching horn solo over jazzy production, while
        "Electrified Teenybop!" is tantalisingly climactic, built on rollicking
        synths and percussion. Welcome back, indeed.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Thom Yorke,
        Mark Pritchard
        –
        Tall Tales
items.label: Warp Records
items.description:
Warp Records

      
        Thom Yorke,
        Mark Pritchard
        –
        Tall Tales
      
      
        Mark Pritchard and Thom Yorke's lockdown album truly reflects the period
        it was created in. Even when the LP is upbeat, there's a sense of
        foreboding. Many of the tracks have a vintage clank that recalls Cabaret
        Voltaire or even Throbbing Gristle at their most accessible; others
        float in an ambient haze. These are songs for anxious times.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Tracey –
        Tracey
items.label: AD 93
items.description:
AD 93

      
        Tracey –
        Tracey
      
      
        Who is Tracey? Arguably one of the most exciting new duos of 2025.
        Across just four tracks, their self-titled EP covers so much sonic
        territory that you're left wondering who is behind all this
        brilliance—and when the album will drop. One minute they're deep in
        grimey dub with MC Riko Dan ("Sex Life"), the next they're serving up
        anguished indie a la Bar Italia ("Take Care"). The style experiments
        arrive in flashes. We only wish there were more.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

BADSISTA –
        CUTEBOYZ
items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Self-released

      
        BADSISTA –
        CUTEBOYZ
      
      
        On this fiery EP, BADSISTA infuses grooves into his percussion-driven
        electronic music. "BBCITA LET'S TAKE A RIDE" has the playful bounce of
        Latin house; "PSYCODELIA" is big-room techno complete with dramatic
        build-up and drop. For a moment, he even pulls us away from peak time
        with the glittering IDM opening of "SPDRIP."

Gigi FM –
        Virgo Space Acid
items.label: Sea~rene Records
items.description:
Sea~rene Records

      
        Gigi FM –
        Virgo Space Acid
      
      
        Nestled in between the precise grooves of Gigi FM's intense techno is an
        organic New Age feel, delivered via an intricate tapestry of warped,
        minuscule sounds. Virgo Space Acid distills her hypnotic rhythms
        to their bare essentials, focusing on delicious loops and driving acid
        synths.
      
      
        Listen:

items.title:
Verraco –
        Basic Maneuvers
items.label: XL Recordings
items.description:
XL Recordings

      
        Verraco –
        Basic Maneuvers
      
      
        Verraco knows how to twist momentous grooves into his high-speed club
        music. Tribal, hardgroove and raptor house all have a place in this
        energetic melange. But the Medellín producer is equally skilled in
        emphasising intricate details. His latest EP,
        Basic Maneuvers, shows this range. The title track races through
        sweaty Latin club music, while "Total" is industrial dub peppered with
        swirls of metallic clanks and what sounds like the shuffling rhythms of
        baile funk, slowed all the way down.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Moin –
        Belly Up
items.label: AD 93
items.description:
AD 93

      
        Moin –
        Belly Up
      
      
        With curious lyrics like, "I guess this day… couldn't be this day… I
        guess it couldn't be the day," Moin's music might not be narrative-led,
        but it's certainly adept at setting the
        mood. And the vibe of their new EP is the same laid-back chic
        that flourishes in experimental venues and late-night cafés: spoken
        word, reversed instrumentation and gritty, nocturnal synths.

items.title:
GIDEÖN,
        Rush Davis
        –
        The Two Houses EP
items.label: HOMO-CENTRIC RECORDS
items.description:
HOMO-CENTRIC RECORDS

      
        GIDEÖN,
        Rush Davis
        –
        The Two Houses EP
      
      
        Two Houses is a homage to two iconic ballroom houses: House of LaBeija
        and House of Xtravaganza. Most notably, the vocals, coming from Rush
        Davis, commemorate the late trans luminaries that defined that scene in
        the late 20th century. Every track on this 12-inch lands with a punch,
        as garage house shuffles, whomping basslines and glamorous strings
        create irresistible dynamics beneath Davis's poetic ruminations.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title: United in Flames
items.description:
Malibu,
      Oklou
      
        United in Flames
      
      
        If Denmark is the current home of esoteric pop queens, then France is
        emerging as a worthy contender for the crown. Here, electronic darlings
        Malibu and Oklou link up to present ephemeral fragments of forgotten pop
        hits. With samples ranging from bambinodj to TikTok videos, the mix
        offers a glimpse into the pair's colourful minds.

items.title: Live at Dekmantel Selectors 2021 (Beach Stage Closing)
items.description:
HUNEE
      
        Live at Dekmantel Selectors 2021 (Beach Stage Closing)
      
      
        "A wildly exuberant moment in the oddest of timelines." This recording
        from one of Hunee's first gigs after lockdown captures three hours of
        uninhibited joy. Opening with roaring saxophones, the set blends
        everything from thumping disco to the deep house stylings of Isolee,
        Carl Craig and Jump Source. Oh, and just wait for the Talking Heads
        bootleg.

items.title: Sustain-Release Year Ten
items.description:
CCL
      
        Sustain-Release Year Ten
      
      
        CCL is a
        DJ's DJ—and
        this live recording from Sustain-Release proves it. A spoken word
        sample, dubwise textures and heaps of bass lay the foundation for ample
        genre hopping. It's sludgy, mystical and slightly emo—think James K and
        The Durutti Column—so it's no surprise that many reported tears on the
        dance floor.

items.title: Spaces In Between: 100% Production Mix
items.description:
Introspekt
      
        Spaces In Between: 100% Production Mix
      
      
        Dubstep may have been born in the UK, but this session from
        Introspekt
        could convince you that the US is currently where it's at. In this
        hour-long mix, the New York-based producer nails the genre's signature
        swing and bassy whomp—an excellent preview of her highly anticipated
        debut album for Tempa.

items.title: Nous'klaer Radio 40
items.description:
Hervé
      
        Nous'klaer Radio 40
      
      
        Rotterdam label Nous'klaer Audio is a proper family affair, united by a
        shared love of windswept melodies. Its mix series is no different, with
        the latest edition welcoming fellow Rotterdammer and Club RAUM resident
        Hervé. The two-hour, vinyl-only mix is a real treat, showcasing the
        depth of his collection, from expansive house to underwater acid and
        electro.

items.title: Kiosk Radio x The Lot Radio at Horst Festival 2025
items.description:
Cousin
      
        Kiosk Radio x The Lot Radio at Horst Festival 2025
      
      
        A wave of
        Australian talent
        has broken through since the pandemic, bringing with it a scuttling,
        psychedelic sound inspired by the country's signature bush doofs.
        Sydney-based DJ and producer Cousin is one of the movement's standout
        names. This 90-minute recording, fresh from the 2025 edition of Horst,
        captures him leaning into the more stripped-back side of that sound,
        with low-slung, trippy minimalism that recalls RPR (plus the odd batida
        curveball).

items.title: ED0042
items.description:
Ekkel
      
        ED0042
      
      
        Ekkel doesn't record many mixes, but when he does, he goes all out. As
        cofounder of Norway's Ute crew, he champions the kind of contemporary
        psychedelic trance that lights up everywhere from Bassiani to Australian
        bush parties. Recorded live at Everybody Trance x XTF in Lyon earlier
        this year, this set starts with a steady stream of trippers before
        diving into squelchy territory with a subtlety often missing in the
        genre.

items.title: Objet Personnel
items.description:
Softburn

      
        Objet Personnel
      
      
        Düsseldorf-based DJ and Heavy Rotation member softburn offers swirling
        ambient and blissful beats that feel like a head massage. Swapping
        low-end pressure for fuzzy downtempo, this exceptional Callshop Radio
        show is perfect for fending off the Sunday scaries.

items.title:
SHERELLE –
        WITH A VENGEANCE
items.label: Method 808
items.description:
Method 808
      
        SHERELLE –
        WITH A VENGEANCE
      
      
        Channelling the magic of her raucous DJ sets, SHERELLE's debut album
        moves through footwork, jungle and drum & bass with ease. But the record
        also proves that London's 160 connoisseur can take on much more. Garage
        909 kicks shuffle across the pansexual anthem "FREAKY (JUST MY TYPE);"
        "XTC SUSP9ND3D" uses a blipping hardcore vocal before a torrent of
        layered footwork sub-bass floods in; and she even includes Cameo Blush's
        moody saxophone melody on "LOVE YOUR ENEMIES."
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Skrillex –
        F*CK U SKRILLEX YOU THINK UR ANDY WARHOL BUT UR NOT!!<3
items.label: Atlantic
items.description:
Atlantic
      
        Skrillex –
        F*CK U SKRILLEX YOU THINK UR ANDY WARHOL BUT UR NOT!!<3 
      
      
        Surprise-released on April Fools' Day, Skrillex's chaotic,
        tongue-in-cheek fourth album plays like a seamless, drop-heavy mix
        rather than a traditional LP. F*CK U is stuffed with formerly
        unreleased productions that fans have long been hearing in his sets.
        Returning to his early-'10s brostep roots, Skrillex includes the roaring
        drops and dopamine hits that defined the era—but this time he corrects
        history, including dubstep veterans like Majestic and
        Joker.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Spotify

items.title:
Jane Remover
        –
        Revengeseekerz
items.label: deadAir
items.description:
deadAir
      
        Jane Remover
        –
        Revengeseekerz
      
      
        On Revengeseekerz, Jane Remover's surprise third record, they
        race through their earliest, long-abandoned digicore work with newfound
        dexterity. Noise columns meet otherworldly, loosely stacked guitar
        notes. Standout "Professional Vengeance" could've been a Pixies song in
        another life, if the group played so hard and fast that the studio
        imploded. At their best, these songs join traditional emo with overblown
        electronics so seamlessly that you forget the American musician once
        debated choosing between the two.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Spotify

        race through their earliest, long-abandoned digicore work with newfound

items.title:
Barker –
        Stochastic Drift
items.label: Smalltown Supersound
items.description:
Smalltown Supersound
      
        Barker –
        Stochastic Drift
      
      
        On the excellent follow-up to his debut album,
        Utility,
        Barker
        adds acoustic warmth to his well-worn arpeggios. The LP flits between
        the icy, mathematical precision of a Y2K-era IDM album and woody live
        instrumentation. A true thing of beauty.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Nazar –
        Demilitarize
items.label: Hyperdub
items.description:
Hyperdub
      
        Nazar –
        Demilitarize
      
      
        War is a central theme of Nazar's work. The lasers that blast through
        the redlining sub-bass of "Warning Shots," off his debut EP
        Enclave, were an early taste of what the Amsterdam-based producer would later
        call "rough kuduro." His delicate and sometimes downtrodden Dawuna-esque
        vocals are the most striking development of his second album,
        Demilitarize. Nazar's voice often steps lightly, casting glimmers
        of brilliance over the LP's murky kuduro waters.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

        of brilliance over the LP's murky kuduro waters.

items.title:
Red Pig Flower
        –
        Practice Love
items.label: Sound Of Vast
items.description:
Sound Of Vast
      
        Red Pig Flower
        –
        Practice Love
      
      
        Practice Love is the debut album from Red Pig Flower, the
        Korean-Japanese artist based between Berlin and London. Here, she
        touches nearly every inch of the global house scene. There's the New
        York musicality of "Sax and Drugs;" springy prog-house on "Thisiz House
        Music," reminiscent of the '00s Melbourne scene; and the effusive
        positivity of the title track, which channels the energy of Eris Drew's
        Motherbeat philosophy.
        Practice Love is best summed up by the unifying message of the
        closer: "No Genre, Only Music."
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Hieroglyphic Being
        –
        Dance Music 4 Bad People
items.label: Smalltown Supersound
items.description:
Smalltown Supersound
      
        Hieroglyphic Being
        –
        Dance Music 4 Bad People
      
      
        Chicago producer Hieroglyphic Being has been partying for a long time.
        "40 years later," he said about the club scene in
        Dance Music 4 Bad People's liner notes, "it's drastically
        different—everybody's angry!" His latest album is an attempt to change
        that. In the distorted, crunchy haze that typically defines his music,
        he brings out funky, wayward synth lines and drums. This is the kind of
        adventurous house that only Hieroglyphic Being can create, with each
        delightfully strange track centred around a perfect loop.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Katarina Gryvul
        –
        SPOMYN
items.label: Subtext
items.description:
Subtext
      
        Katarina Gryvul
        –
        SPOMYN
      
      
        Fans of Arca and
        Björk will love Katarina
        Gryvul's third album—a haunting collection of choral pop bludgeoned with
        mechanical kicks and horror-style digital detritus. But it's all
        anchored by her voice, an instrument she twists into squeals on "MERTVI
        ZHYTTYAM," layers into ethereal, operatic masterpieces ("SONTSE
        PAM'YATTI") and distorts until it sounds like roaring pads on "POLE
        POLYNU."
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Ploy –
        It's Later Than You Think
items.label: Dekmantel
items.description:
Dekmantel
      
        Ploy –
        It's Later Than You Think
      
      
        London-based producer Ploy has consistently put out bassy, percussive
        dance music that many now think of as "UK techno." But on new album,
        It's Later Than You Think, he makes a hard left turn to take on
        the vast spectrum of house. There's the hardgroove-meets-house of
        "Admirer," and "Monsters," a throwback to the early-'90s drum work of DJ
        Pierre and Zip's '00s minimal. "Stringz" balances the old and new Ploy:
        mixing his new love of hard house with wormhole techno.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

        dance music that many now think of as "UK techno." But on new album,
        It's Later Than You Think, he makes a hard left turn to take on
        the vast spectrum of house. There's the hardgroove-meets-house of

        mixing his new love of hard house with wormhole techno.

items.title:
Djrum –
        Under The Tangled Silence
items.label: Houndstooth
items.description:
Houndstooth
      
        Djrum –
        Under The Tangled Silence
      
      
        Djrum's last
        album, Portrait With Firewood, weaved sombre acoustic instruments
        into spacious ambient and IDM. On this follow-up, he brightens the
        emotional palette, creating striking interplays between melody and
        rhythm. The spritely "Waxcap" trills like birdsong, with bursts of
        squiggly percussion that never quite stay in the same place. "Out Of
        Dust" contains even more surprises, a shapeshifting patchwork of vocal
        snippets, drums and piano notes.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Avi Loud,
        Liano –
        BAPE TAPE
items.label: Heck World Radio
items.description:
Heck World Radio
      
        Avi Loud,
        Liano –
        BAPE TAPE
      
      
        As part of Los Angeles-based collective Dance Maniacs, Avi Loud and
        Liano approach dance music from unique angles. Avi Loud is drawn to
        Latin house, hardgroove and garage, while Liano has an affinity for
        breaks-driven club tracks. On their collaborative album,
        BAPE TAPE, they meld these influences with impressive cohesion,
        from "Workout"'s clipped hardgroove-leaning vocals to the Jersey
        indebted, booty-shaking momentum of "Bring It Back."
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Various Artists –
        Pattern Gardening
items.label: Wisdom Teeth
items.description:
Wisdom Teeth
      
        Various Artists –
        Pattern Gardening
      
      
        UK label Wisdom Teeth has long been a home for artists that make joyful,
        brain-tickling music. On Pattern Gardening, label bosses Facta &
        K-LONE take their high-spirited vision to new heights. Polygonia's video
        game-style arpeggios are full of delight on "(=o_o=)," while rRoxymore's
        "Nightbite" features softly bubbling rhythms and swirling fairy dust.
        Things lean harder on the album, too, such as on Daisy Moon's
        "Eradication," which falls somewhere between electro and seductive
        progressive house. A real treat.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
v1fro –
        Amnesia EP
items.label: Club Romántico
items.description:
Club Romántico
      
        v1fro –
        Amnesia EP
      
      
        On this EP, Venezuelan native v1fro proves he's fit to carry on raptor
        house's legacy. Like the best of the homegrown dance genre, once the
        momentum starts, it drives relentlessly forward with every galloping
        drum loop. But he also takes the sound further. On "Amnesia," you hear
        snippets of house and tunnelling acid lines, while bleating synths on
        "Piñata" feel primed for a carnival sound system. The remix treatments
        include none other than Bok Bok, Coffintexts and raptor house originator
        DJ Babatr.
      

      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Sleep D –
        Big Sky, Liquid Sun
items.label: Butter Sessions
items.description:
Butter Sessions
      
        Sleep D –
        Big Sky, Liquid Sun
      
      
        Arriving just in time for Earth Month, Sleep D's latest EP is full of
        terrestrial wonders. "Green Thumbs" takes its sparkly ambience and
        downtempo pace from serene plant life, while "Acheron Caulderon" (named
        after the Greek underworld's "river of woe") is tunnelling techno that
        still maintains Sleep D's signature glistening atmospheres.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Jump Source
        –
        JS06
items.label: Jump Source
items.description:
Jump Source
      
        Jump Source
        –
        JS06
      
      
        Will "On" be the song of the summer? Time will tell, but for now we're
        certain it's rousing dance floors. A track that features shout-outs can
        really get a crowd going, so with Martyn Bootyspoon's gravelly voice
        checking in on everyone from "New York to Milan" and the "front row
        getting down," this is a bona fide hit. The rest of the EP is just as
        strong, with "Bleach" representing classic Montreal progressive
        house—ebullient and driving.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
DJ MARIA.,
        Audrey Danza
        –
        Inner Call
items.label: Proxima
items.description:
Proxima
      
        DJ MARIA.,
        Audrey Danza
        –
        Inner Call
      
      
        Tokyo's
        DJ MARIA. makes
        techno that washes over you in psychedelic waves; all deep, immersive
        cuts with nimble arrangements. Swiss producer Audrey Danza, on the other
        hand, is known for storming Switzerland's underground electronic scene
        with her powerful take on trance and dark, progressive house. On this
        collaborative EP, their styles beautifully coalesce through skippy
        trance kicks and whirring techno pads.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Trim –
        No Caller ID
items.label: Tectonic
items.description:
Tectonic
      
        Trim –
        No Caller ID
      
      
        In commemoration of the legendary dubstep label Tectonic
        turning 20, grime MC Trim
        and Pinch have linked up for a celebratory outing. Trim is known for
        making outsider grime peppered with jazz, hip-hop, soul and whatever
        else takes his fancy—nothing is off the cards. On No Caller ID,
        Pinch underpins Trim's self-aware rhymes with yet another of his musical
        influences: disorienting dub. Play this one loud.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Carré –
        Body Shell
items.label: Tempa
items.description:
Tempa
      
        Carré –
        Body Shell
      
      
        London-via-Los Angeles artist Carré is responsible for some of the
        sleekest dubstep in recent years. Here, she lands on one of the genre's
        most iconic labels, Tempa, with a tantalising suite of minimal and
        melodic rollers—all anchored by wall-rattling bass weight. But heavy as
        it is, the productions are still elegantly roomy. Just listen to "Faded
        Form," which feels simultaneously close and miles away.
      
      Read the full review

items.title:
PinkPantheress
        –
        Tonight
items.label: Warner Records
items.description:
Warner Records
      
        PinkPantheress
        –
        Tonight
      
      
        "Tonight" is the most club-ready song that PinkPantheress has delivered
        in some time. With crisp, balmy chords and a carefree UK garage skip,
        this is the artist's clear play to honour the UK underground stylings
        she grew up on while setting the stage for a more mainstream audience.
        The lyrics are deliriously fun in the way music should be in the
        warmer months. Expect to hear "You want sex with me? (huh) / Come talk
        to me (come on!)" on your local dance floor soon.
      
      
        Listen:
        SoundCloud
      
    
        "Tonight" is the most club-ready song that PinkPantheress has delivered
        in some time. With crisp, balmy chords and a carefree UK garage skip,
        this is the artist's clear play to honour the UK underground stylings
        she grew up on while setting the stage for a more mainstream audience.

        warmer months. Expect to hear "You want sex with me? (huh) / Come talk

k means

items.title: Zjoso Live @ Golden Plains Festival
items.description:
Zjoso
      
        Zjoso Live @ Golden Plains Festival
      
      
        Tribqu founder Zjoso brought some serious soul to his two-hour set at
        Australia's Golden Plains Festival last month. From heads-down deep
        house and UKG to summery jungle and footwork, this is festival DJing at
        its most liberated. And don't just take our word for it—CCL
        called it "an immaculate and refreshing set that let me know anything
        was possible."

items.title: Making Time 2024
items.description:
John Talabot
      
        Making Time 2024
      
      
        John Talabot has long defied categorisation with sets that slip between
        genres with intention and finesse. House? Not quite. Techno? Close, but
        not really. Eclectic? Sure, but that barely scratches the surface. In
        this recording from the 2024 edition of Philadelphia's Making Time
        festival, one thing's clear: Talabot is fully locked in, moving through
        everything from sleazy acid to high-octane trance.

items.title: The Basic Moves Of … KUBA'97 (Live at Horst Club 2025)
items.description:
Kuba'97
      
        The Basic Moves Of … KUBA'97 (Live at Horst Club 2025)
      
      
        Nightlife in Brussels seems to be undergoing a renaissance. This mix
        captures exactly why. Recorded live in the Garage room at Horst—
        designed and built by Kuba'97 himself—this session dives deep into
        trippy textures and moods, from old Belgian EBM to minimal house. It's
        adventurous, challenging and a clear reflection of why the city's
        underground is thriving: open ears and open minds, on both sides of the
        booth.

items.title: NTS Radio (Fifth World)
items.description:
bambinodj
      
        NTS Radio (Fifth World)
      
      
        Fifth World, Ian Kim Judd's monthly NTS Radio show, explores imagined
        utopias. Berlin producer and SoundCloud cult hero bambinodj delivers one
        that's delightfully unhinged. Think ambient bliss derailed into
        underwater dub, bonkers mash-ups and euphoric chaos. If you're into
        Slagwerk, Night Slugs or Malibu, you're in for some heat. (Disclaimer:
        This dropped in February—but it's too good not to share.)

items.title: SØNDR 061
items.description:
Masaka Masaka
      
        SØNDR 061
      
      
        Kampala-based Masaka Masaka steps up for Berlin's SØNDER mix series,
        delivering an hour of taut, twitchy techno that shows exactly why he's
        one of Uganda's most exciting DJs. Skittering drums, shoegaze haze and
        dub-soaked FX come together in a high-powered yet intricately textured
        ride.

items.title:
Hiroshi Yoshimura –
        Flora
items.label: Temporal Drift
items.description:
Temporal Drift
      
        Hiroshi Yoshimura –
        Flora
      
      
        Hiroshi Yoshimura was a revered figure in
        kankyō ongaku,
        Japan's environmental music scene, known for creating artfully
        unobtrusive works like Surround and the seminal
        Music for Nine Post Cards. This posthumous album offers a fresh perspective on a musician best
        known for meditative atmospherics. In contrast to the quiet subtleties
        of his early records, tracks like "Maple Syrup Factory" sound like
        Yoshimura's equivalent of a pop song. Bouncy and engaging,
        Flora's playful pace actively asks for your focus.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
aya –
        hexed!
items.label: Hyperdub
items.description:
Hyperdub
      
        aya –
        hexed!
      
      
        The cosmic darkness of
        aya's debut
        album, im hole, is best captured by its lead single, "Emley
        lights us moor." The song is terrifying, comprising macabre field
        recordings and uneasy synths that soundtrack a mind seemingly caught
        between psychosis and epiphany. Three years on, the most surprising
        aspect of aya's follow-up, hexed!, is just how deliberately it
        functions as a sequel: eerie spoken-word morphs into screams, while
        drums and lasers clatter together relentlessly. On hexed!, she
        draws from metalcore, IDM and hardstyle, ditching cloistered inwardness
        for a cathartic expulsion of energy.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Unspecified Enemies –
        Romance in the Age of Adaptive Feedback
items.label: Numbers.
items.description:
Numbers.
      
        Unspecified Enemies –
        Romance in the Age of Adaptive Feedback
      
      
        Louis Digital—AKA Unspecified Enemies—has always looked ahead with a
        cynical eye. His scattered discography often references the late urban
        theorist Mike Davis, namechecking his interrogations of systems of
        power, explored in books like City of Quartz and
        Ecology of Fear. Louis Digital moulded the first Unspecified
        Enemies album from puzzle pieces of synths, samples and sequences made
        in the early '00s. Romance in the Age of Adaptive Feedback flips
        Davis's pessimism to transmit the hopeful mood of the new millennium.
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Logic1000
        –
        DJ-Kicks: Logic1000
items.label: !K7
items.description:
!K7
      
        Logic1000
        –
        DJ-Kicks: Logic1000
      
      
        Logic1000's DJ-Kicks entry dips into a startlingly intimate
        headspace. Though decades separate the release dates of her selections,
        her transitions grow together with preternatural symbiosis. Entries from
        the actual '90s—a quick excerpt from Dettinger's 1999 ambient pop
        touchstone Intershop, the intro to Wamdue Kids' 1996 deep house
        LP These Branching Moments—knit into contemporary Y2K throwbacks,
        like the smouldering trip-hop of a.s.o.'s "Somebody" and the ethereal
        downtempo of Moon Holiday's "Definitely."
      
      Read the full review
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Sandwell District
        –
        End Beginnings
items.label: The Point Of Departure
items.description:
The Point Of Departure
      
        Sandwell District
        –
        End Beginnings
      
      
        When Silent Servant died in 2024, the tragedy triggered an outpouring of
        sorrow from the artists, fans and friends he touched, both as a solo
        artist and part of techno collective Sandwell District.
        End Beginnings is a masterclass in devastatingly uncompromising
        techno, completed by surviving members
        Function and Regis. Their reverb-heavy loops have always been melancholic at their core,
        but here, they recede further into the darkness. It's a beautiful elegy.
      
      Read the full review

      
        Listen:
        Spotify

items.title:
Yetsuby –
        4EVA
items.label: Pink Oyster Records
items.description:
Pink Oyster Records
      
        Yetsuby –
        4EVA
      
      
        4EVA is by far the most vibrant and dance floor-oriented of
        Yetsuby's solo records, finding common ground in the torrent of breaks
        and bass that build its rhythmic core. The UK club canon holds court on
        the album, manifesting as a sliding scale of extremes from the
        bitcrushed, whippet-pressurised subs of "SOUNDCLOUD" to the sweet and
        hooky pop breakbeats of "Aestheti-Q."
      
      Read the full review

      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Los Thuthanaka –
        Los Thuthanaka
items.label: Self-Released
items.description:
Self-Released
      
        Los Thuthanaka –
        Los Thuthanaka
      
      
        At long last, the follow-up to Joshua Chuquimia Crampton's
        Estrella por Estrella and Chuquimamani-Condori's DJ E is
        here. The experimental sibling duo have joined forces on their debut
        album as Los Thuthanaka. The LP makes excellent use of Joshua's
        emotional, drone-like bass guitar work, while Chiquimamani-Condori's
        blown-out collages of ronroco, teclas and bombo italaque make even the
        most granular moments swell with hope, wonder and spirituality.
      
      Read the full review

      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Time Cow –
        Scaring 1100 Chickens To Death
items.label: Kullijhan Records
items.description:
Kullijhan Records
      
        Time Cow –
        Scaring 1100 Chickens To Death
      
      
        As a founding member of Jamaica's Equiknoxx crew, Time Cow has spent
        many years reinvigorating dub and dancehall for a modern generation.
        Recently, the producer has made a new home for his solo and
        collaborative work in Kullijhan Records.
        Scaring 1100 Chickens To Death, his debut album for the label,
        isn't as scary as its title suggests: clicky percussion dribbles through
        weighty low-end on "Guns Drugs and 800 Parrots" and synths squawk like
        screeching parrots on "Soca Numa."
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
8ULENTINA
        –
        SURPASSING DISASTER
items.label: SILLAGE
items.description:
SILLAGE
      
        8ULENTINA
        –
        SURPASSING DISASTER
      
      
        8ULENTINA's debut LP comes after more than a decade of helping steer the
        Bay Area and New York underground.
        SURPASSING DISASTER as informed by industrial and dark ambient as
        the artist's Turkish roots. Arab acoustic instrumentation is threaded
        into haunting corridors of crushed bass and blistering kicks. The
        cursive whispers of a ney meld into cinematic synths on "Devotional,"
        while rich-toned hand drums and cymbals punctuate the sinister synthline
        on "Desire Ruse." A spellbinding work.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
DJ Narciso
        –
        Diferenciado
items.label: Príncipe
items.description:
Príncipe
      
        DJ Narciso
        –
        Diferenciado
      
      
        Príncipe
        showcases another impressive configuration of Lisbon's thriving batida
        scene with DJ Narciso's debut LP. The producer, who's also the brain
        behind the collective Rs Produções, carves out a sound that carries a
        lilting danceability (perfectly demonstrated on "Pipipi" or "5 Do Jo")
        while "Underground dos Loucos" and "30 Paus" champion the more choppy,
        experimental edges of club music.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Various Artists –
        Sueños en la Tormenta
items.label: Headroom Records
items.description:
Headroom Records
      
        Various Artists –
        Sueños en la Tormenta
      
      
        Bogotá-born producer CRRDR has been one of the loudest supporters of
        post-pandemic Latin-made club music—a movement he playfully dubbed "Latincore." This compilation he curated highlights an exhilarating blend of UK
        hardcore and rhythmic club sounds that fold in elements of raptor house,
        speed dembow and cumbia. This is music to make the floor shake—from the
        lightning-fast baile funk of LAZA's "Perturbação" to the steamy guaracha
        of Noro$t's "Déjela Sonar."
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Whatever The Weather –
        Whatever The Weather II
items.label: Ghostly International
items.description:
Ghostly International
      
        Whatever The Weather –
        Whatever The Weather II
      
      
        Loraine James's fragmented music puts a heartfelt bent on glitchy IDM,
        gilded atmospherics and hushed, intimate vocals. But when she debuted
        her Whatever The Weather alias in 2022, she leaned further into her
        long-standing guitar and ambient influences, such as on the frigid,
        delicate chords of "0°C" and the skipping, airy pads of "30°C." Her
        second album under this name evokes images of arid terrain and
        sun-dappled dirt, with productions that shine with golden hues.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
DJ Python
        –
        i was put on this earth
items.label: XL Recordings
items.description:
XL Recordings
      
        DJ Python
        –
        i was put on this earth
      
      
        DJ Python's Luis alias has long been a vessel for his '90s chillout
        stylings, and has increasingly bled into other areas of his discography.
        2023's
        Natural Wonder Beauty Concept project with Ana Roxanne, for
        example, showcased less of the "deep reggaeton" he made his name with,
        instead presenting a gorgeous world of detuned keys, breakbeats and
        melodic IDM. Python's latest solo EP, i was put on this earth,
        feels like a natural progression, making elegant use of bleeps, burling
        guitar and the low-key vocals of Isabella Lovestory and Jawnino. A
        meditative beauty.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
SoFTT –
        HaRDD
items.label: PAN
items.description:
PAN
      
        SoFTT –
        HaRDD
      
      
        Rising Miami duo SoFTT make trance that conjures images of air-brushed
        crop tops and sweaty pool parties. On HaRDD, vocalist Kablito's
        sugary tone coats driving synthlines, but she completes her pop star arc
        with hooky songs like "Cera El Cielo." On the more vulnerable "Linda,
        Triste, Una Pop Star," she ponders traditional family life in Spanish,
        before she remembers with a laugh, "my boyfriend and I, we're DJs."
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Actress –
        Grey Interiors
items.label: Smalltown Supersound
items.description:
Smalltown Supersound
      
        Actress –
        Grey Interiors
      
      
        Actress originally made Grey Interiors for Berliner Festspiele.
        The piece, recorded as a continuous 20-minute track, is now available to
        the wider public. Grey Interiors slips in and out of immersive
        white noise, occasionally opening up little pathways of clear-eyed
        melodies. Surreal piano and chimes break through, then dissolve into the
        darkness once again. It's the soundtrack for a scene in constant motion.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Maara –
        Big Whoops
items.label: Ancient Records
items.description:
Ancient Records
      
        Maara –
        Big Whoops
      
      
        As a sapphic experience, Big Whoops is an EP that exists in the
        slinky continuum between cuddly slumber parties and late-night raves.
        Undecipherable whispers flower in the cracks of proggy rhythms; gasps of
        delight echo through the mix. As proven time and again with Maara's
        work, it's the little details that make for the grandest displays of
        seduction.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
MoMA Ready
        –
        MR001
items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Self-released
      
        MoMA Ready
        –
        MR001
      
      
        The agenda of MoMA Ready's first record of 2025? Gritty, romantic house.
        The New York producer leaves behind samples to put his own words front
        and centre, bringing earnest poetry to songs like "Suddenly," where love
        begets feelings of self-acceptance ("I feel like I belong / And there's
        nothing wrong"). The emotional tone of the EP—and the ecstasy it chases
        after—is no less driving than his peak-time anthems. On "Feel Like
        That," over a nasty bassline that slithers close to the floor, he asks,
        "How do you feel?"
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

        The New York producer leaves behind samples to put his own words front
        and centre, bringing earnest poetry to songs like "Suddenly," where love
        begets feelings of self-acceptance ("I feel like I belong / And there's
        nothing wrong"). The emotional tone of the EP—and the ecstasy it chases
        after—is no less driving than his peak-time anthems. On "Feel Like
        That," over a nasty bassline that slithers close to the floor, he asks,
        "How do you feel?"

items.title:
1OO1O –
        BREAKBEAT BOUTIQUE
items.label: DistroKid
items.description:
DistroKid
      
        1OO1O –
        BREAKBEAT BOUTIQUE
      
      
        Mexico-based producer 1OO1O makes hardgroove inspired by the Latin
        rhythms around him. BREAKBEAT BOUTIQUE pays tribute to his US
        influences—tracks like "Jupiter Jazz" (sharing a name with the song by
        '90s Detroit techno group Galaxy 2 Galaxy) pay tribute to techno's
        origins while adding a playful touch of disco and funk. "Derby City
        Classic" pushes the envelope further, creatively connecting the dots
        between hoover, hardgroove and garage.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Jlin –
        B12
items.label: Jlin Metalabel
items.description:
Jlin Metalabel
      
        Jlin –
        B12
      
      
        Sydney's Powerhouse Museum is home to half a million objects. Its new
        initiative, Sounding the Collection, allows musicians to access
        this archive and use samples recorded at the museum to create their own
        original musical responses. On B12, Jlin makes use of a talking
        robot, an Irish harp and a wire-tying machine, with hazy melodies
        grounding the rhythmic chaos. This might just be the closest thing to
        hip-hop she's worked on in recent years.
      
      
        Listen:
        Metalabel

items.title:
Pixl &
        Peeb –
        Old Citrus
items.label: Future Retro London
items.description:
Future Retro London
      
      
        Pixl &
        Peeb –
        Old Citrus
      
      
        Tim Reaper's
        Future Retro label is a place for the jungle producer to release the
        work of peers he deeply respects. Projects are formed out of
        conversations about music, or in Pixl & Peeb's case, music that Reaper
        plays on his NTS Radio shows. After a year of being sent Pixl & Peeb's
        music, Reaper decided to release Old Citrus, a collection of
        soulful jungle with harmonies shrouded in R&B melodies.

items.title:
Jorg Kuning
        –
        Elvers Pass
items.label: Wisdom Teeth
items.description:
Wisdom Teeth
      
        Jorg Kuning
        –
        Elvers Pass
      
      
        Welshpool-based producer Jorg Kuning puts house, bass, techno and
        electro through the blender. His latest EP for Wisdom Teeth is replete
        with burbling, groovy tracks that sound delightfully froggy. The synths
        are bright and flashy, but the slippery beats and thumping subs deepen
        the mood and bring listeners closer to the dance floor. A real treat.

items.title: The Dubstep-Tech House Connection
items.label:
Beatrice M.
        &
        Appleblim
items.description:
Beatrice M.
        &
        Appleblim
      
      
        The Dubstep-Tech House Connection
      
      
        The Paris-based BAIT label boss
        Beatrice M.
        has emerged as a key figure in reshaping dubstep in the 2020s, picking
        up where pioneers like Peverelist and Pinch left off. Their fascination
        with "techy" dubstep and the history of crossover sounds, dating back to
        the early 2000s, informs this NTS Radio broadcast, which is part mix,
        part talk show. Beatrice M. blends tracks with insights from Appleblim,
        and discusses the genre's evolution from dubstep's deeper, soulful roots
        to its influence on minimal and tech house.

items.title: 8˚C
items.label: Richard Akingbehin
items.description:
Richard Akingbehin
      
        8˚C
      
      
        Unless you've been living under a rock, you've likely heard whispers
        that dub techno is
        back. Richard
        Akingbehin, the expert in our recent
        history of vocal dub techno, dives deep into the genre with a 90-minute mix that immerses you in
        its signature reverb and hypnotic depth. The Kynant Records boss puts it
        best in the accompanying interview: "One of my most used words to
        describe the feeling of a track is 'underwater.'"

items.title: BFC ADE 2024: RADION Saturday
items.label:
Marcel Dettmann
        & Ogazón
items.description:
Marcel Dettmann
        & Ogazón
      
      
        BFC ADE 2024: RADION Saturday
      
      
        Last October, two generations of techno collided as
        Ogazón
        and
        Marcel Dettmann
        went head-to-head for four electrifying hours at Breakfast Club's ADE
        takeover of RADION. The real star of the show was the crowd, who lapped
        up the world-class house and groove-driven techno. As Ogazón reflected,
        the duo were so deeply connected to the audience that it felt like "a
        homecoming—warm, familiar and charged with energy." of the audience that
        it felt like "a homecoming—warm, familiar and charged with energy."

items.title: Baalti - NTS
items.label: Baalti
items.description:
Baalti
      
        Baalti - NTS
      
      
        Just before releasing their outstanding new EP
        Mela
        last month, New York duo Baalti went deep on India's sound system music
        for NTS Radio. A bespoke blend of Indian and UK club music, it's a
        hi-octane hour of unreleased originals and hard drum highlights that are
        as loud as they are proud. (Full disclaimer: OK, we know this dropped in
        February, but it was too good to leave out.)

items.title: Live At Podlasie Chicago
items.label:
Lefto Early Bird
        &
        Marco Weibel
items.description:
Lefto Early Bird
        &
        Marco Weibel
      
      
        Live At Podlasie Chicago
      
      
        Brussels-based DJ Lefto Early Bird and New York's Marco Weibel played a
        rowdy back-to-back at Podlasie Club in Chicago earlier this month,
        delivering just over an hour of peak-time madness. They kept each other
        on their toes, stitching together grime, disco, subby techno and
        heart-warming deep house.

items.title: Live @ The Spookathon
items.label: DJ Sweet6teen
items.description:
DJ Sweet6teen
      
        Live @ The Spookathon
      
      
        It's hard to believe that DJ sweet6teen only started collecting records
        during the pandemic. Just take one listen to this 98-minute recording
        from spooky season's unofficial mascots, The Ghost Halloween, and you'll
        see what we mean. Designed to feel like "someone breaking into your
        house," it's wicked stuff—a haunted house soundtrack, but in Ibiza.
        Sleek deep house and rolling tech-y grooves give way to punchy,
        spine-tingling electro, keeping things tense yet effortlessly cool.

items.title: Carnaval Novo Affair ✿ São Paulo
items.label:
Kontronatura
        &
        Nick León
items.description:
Kontronatura
        &
        Nick León
      
      
        Carnaval Novo Affair ✿ São Paulo
      
      
        Kontronatura, resident at São Paulo's
        Mamba Negra party, went back-to-back with
        Nick León
        to close out Novo Affair's Carnival celebration with a tour de force of
        contemporary club music. They built the vibe with patience, moving from
        murky, percussive cuts—66's "Alarma (Sylvere Bouyon Edit)" and DJ Fucci
        & Jensen Interceptor's "Manita de Gato"—into a string of sharp, driving
        selections, from storming electro (Identified Patient's "My Way [Hilton
        Mix]") and pop-infused club (LSDXOXO's remix of Kelela "Soft") to
        Baltimore club
        (Ase Manual's "Senzu").

items.title:
Marie Davidson
        –
        City of Clowns
items.label: Deewee
items.description:
Deewee
      
        Marie Davidson
        –
        City of Clowns
      
      
        In 2022, Marie Davidson became obsessed with Shoshana Zuboff's
        groundbreaking book, The Age of Surveillance Capitalism. So much
        so that Zuboff's alarming arguments about human exploitation informed
        the mechanical breaks and electro arpeggios of the Canadian artist's
        sixth LP. Nevertheless, Davidson's furiously winking humour remains the
        star of the show—just listen to tracks like "Sexy Clown" and "Push Me
        Fuckhead."
      
      Read the full review

      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Traxman –
        Da Mind Of Traxman Vol.3
items.label: Planet Mu
items.description:
Planet Mu
      
        Traxman –
        Da Mind Of Traxman Vol.3
      
      
        Chicago legend Traxman has seen his city's dance music scene through
        numerous iterations—from funky proto-house to ghetto house to footwork.
        Since 2012, the ever-prolific producer has been archiving his
        discography in the Da Mind Of Traxman series. After a ten-year
        hiatus, he returns with a collection that highlights his ghetto house
        past as much as his footwork present.
      
      Read the full review

      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Oklou –
        choke enough
items.label: True Panther Records
items.description:
True Panther Records
      
        Oklou –
        choke enough
      
      
        Oklou's debut album lures her away from the Stockholm syndrome of the
        internet. choke enough sees the Parisian singer venture
        outside—in a world so beautiful, a mid-drive sighting of the moon is
        distracting enough to make her crash her Subaru. Here, baroque pop and
        melodic trance beautifully coalesce to bring her frolics to life.
      
      Read the full review

items.title:
BOOF –
        Night Blooming Cereus
items.label: BubbleTease Communications
items.description:
BubbleTease Communications
      
        BOOF –
        Night Blooming Cereus
      
      
        Every five or so years, fans can expect a new album from Maurice
        Fulton's joyous, flower-themed alias, BOOF. His latest is an upbeat
        delight, moving through jazz, funk and house with the undeniable warmth
        of live instruments. But
        Night Blooming Cereus also weaves in darker, tunnelling techno
        moments that make you understand why this flower thrives at night.
      
      
        Listen:

items.title:
Darkside –
        Nothing
items.label: Matador Records
items.description:
Matador Records
      
        Darkside –
        Nothing
      
      
        DARKSIDE's long-awaited third album largely stems from a process that
        Nicolás Jaar, Dave Harrington and new member, drummer Tlacael Esparza,
        refer to as the "nothing jam." During these sessions, the trio practiced
        mindfulness and reflected on the contradictions of
        nothingness. The result? Warbling, guitar-fuelled songs that
        explore how nothing can mean everything in a crumbling world.
      
      Read the full review

Kelela –
        In the Blue Light
items.label: Warp Records
items.description:
Warp Records
      
        Kelela –
        In the Blue Light
      
      
        In May 2024, one of Kelela's dreams came true. The alt-R&B artist—who as
        a college student once drove from Washington D.C. to New York to visit
        Blue Note—finally made her debut at the historic jazz club. This live
        recording is a tender treat, offering acoustic reworks from
        Cut 4 Me,
        Take Me Apart
        and
        Raven.

Various Artists –
        Bay Area Renegade Trax Vol. 2
items.label: NO BIAS
items.description:
NO BIAS
      
        Various Artists –
        Bay Area Renegade Trax Vol. 2
      
      
        Bay Area-based label and event series NO BIAS thrives off cheeky,
        bombastic bangers. Featuring members Bored Lord, bastiengoat, Honey B
        and JEWELSSEA, the compilation effortlessly presents raucous breaks,
        electro, lo-fi house and pop edits. Listen out for Amerie on Tomi
        Marsi's "The Wall" and all the snaps, claps and delicious detritus that
        makes clubbing fun.

items.title:
Ela Minus
        –
        DÍA
items.label: Domino Recording
items.description:
Domino Recording
      
        Ela Minus
        –
        DÍA
      
      
        What will the apocalypse sound like? Colombian artist Ela Minus
        contemplates the answer on her new album DÍA, which fuses the
        raging energy of the club with shards of coruscating post-punk. It's a
        feeling best encapsulated by opener, "Broken," in which she purposefully
        croons: "I'll keep writing melodies / To sing away the gloom that we
        have succumbed to."
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

Saffron Bloom
        –
        Saffron Bloom
items.label: Delicate Records

Delicate Records
      
        Saffron Bloom
        –
        Saffron Bloom
      
      
        Through his trip-hop alias, Saffron Bloom (AKA New York-based producer
        Sepehr) illustrates noirish, seductive scenes. Fans of Portishead and

        of "Times Up (It's Over)."

        –

items.label: Self-Released
items.description:
Self-Released
      
        Byron The Aquarius
        –
        LOST VAULTS OF BYRON THE AQUARIUS VOL.1
      
      
        Byron The Aquarius is best known for jazzy house on Detroit labels like
        Theo Parrish's Sound Signature and Kyle Hall's Wild Oats. On
        LOST VAULTS, the Atlanta-based artist channels the soulful,
        gospel-influenced essence of '90s R&B. Guest appearances elevate the

Baalti –
        Mela
items.label: Steel City Dance Discs
items.description:
Steel City Dance Discs
      
        Baalti –
        Mela
      
      
        Mela, a Hindi word for "festival," is any kind of banging party
        that brings together strangers, friends, neighbours, colleagues and
        distant relatives. On Steel City Dance Discs' latest EP, New York-based
        duo Jaiveer Singh and Mihir Chauhan create a mela of their own,
        fusing the rattling sounds of Indian sound system culture with an
        overseas style that's nearly as piercing: UK bass music.

items.title:
Nadī,
        Otus –
        Freefall
items.label: all my thoughts
items.description:
all my thoughts
      
        Nadī,
        Otus –
        Freefall
      
      
        South London producers Nadī and Otus make music rooted in cultural
        exchange: weighty UK basslines and skittering breaks meet sinewy
        Bangladeshi vocals. On Freefall, this approach feels like second
        nature, seamlessly layering looped Bengali vocal samples over speed
        garage, dubstep, and on the gloriously chuggy title track, slippery
        ambient techno. Surefire DJ tools.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Lucrecia Dalt
        –
        cosa rara
items.label: World Music
items.description:
World Music
      
        Lucrecia Dalt
        –
        cosa rara
      
      
        Colombian experimental musician Lucrecia Dalt crafts nocturnal music
        indebted to the unsettling soundscapes of surrealist cinema. On her 2024
        album, ¡Ay!, she meditated on her heritage through sci-fi bolero.
        Her latest offering, "cosa rara," (which translates to
        weird thing) builds on this David Lynchian tension, with equally
        uncanny remixes from Mabe Fratti and Matias Aguayo.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp
      
    
        Colombian experimental musician Lucrecia Dalt crafts nocturnal music
        indebted to the unsettling soundscapes of surrealist cinema. On her 2024
        album, ¡Ay!, she meditated on her heritage through sci-fi bolero.
        Her latest offering, "cosa rara," (which translates to
        weird thing) builds on this David Lynchian tension, with equally
        uncanny remixes from Mabe Fratti and Matias Aguayo.

items.title:
WOST –
        Miniteca Selvática
items.label: TraTraTrax
items.description:
TraTraTrax
      
        WOST –
        Miniteca Selvática
      
      
        TraTraTrax's first release of 2025 comes from rising Venezuelan producer
        WOST. His galvanising mix of low-end and vocal samples—invoking raptor
        house, baile funk and UK bass—is primed for peak-time. On his debut EP,
        he strikes gold, inviting Ecuadorian artist Entrañas and Hessle Audio's
        Pangea for a suite of rhythmic club trax. This is what the future of
        Latin electronic music sounds like.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
MUN SING –
        Frolic
items.label: Illegal Data
items.description:
Illegal Data
      
        MUN SING –
        Frolic
      
      
        MUN SING's music is typically built on a foundation of staticky synths
        and heaving low-end. Frolic takes these traits and fits them into
        a hyperpop mould, complete with all the rich songwriting the genre
        demands—from Katy Ketani's girlish voice soaring over Eurodance to
        ROOO's channeling of Mariah Carey, Hayley Williams and Grimes all at
        once. This is MUN SING's most devourable work yet.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Prettybwoy
        –
        Tokyo Ice Age
items.label: SVBKVLT
items.description:
SVBKVLT
      
        Prettybwoy
        –
        Tokyo Ice Age
      
      
        Prettybwoy makes club music that squirms and fidgets. Composed of bright
        melodies and shiny percussion, his music evokes the sound of cartoon
        characters tip-toeing into mischief. On his latest EP, he finds the
        sweet spot between the acoustic and the digital: wintry piano and
        strings melt into futuristic plinks and plonks, creating moments of
        perfect tension.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title: Terror Danjah Tribute
items.label: Spooky
items.description:
Spooky
      

      
        Terror Danjah Tribute
      
      
        Grime lost a great innovator last month with the
        tragic passing
        of revered producer Rodney Pryce, AKA Terror Danjah. Spooky's latest
        dispatch compiles nearly two hours of classics and deep cuts by the late
        artist—a heartfelt reminder of what made Pryce such a special and
        indispensable force in the London genre.

items.title: Recorded at Houghton (2024)
items.label: Batu
items.description:
Batu
      

      
        Recorded at Houghton (2024)
      
      
        Closing the Outburst stage at Houghton 2024, Batu delivered a
        masterclass in how to construct a set. The Timedance boss starts by
        moving through various shades of restraint—think minimal and
        stripped-back tech house á la Mark Henning's 2015 classic
        "Trojan"—before turning up the heat. Stay 'til the end for a final
        crescendo that the Bristol-based artist called "magical."

items.title: Truancy Sessions
items.label: DJ Wiggles
items.description:
DJ Wiggles
      

      
        Truancy Sessions
      
      
        Head of the label, mix and party series kinetic, DJ Wiggles is one of
        London's fastest-rising tastemakers. In her contribution to Truancy
        Sessions—Truants' new mix series for emerging artists—she flexes her
        muscles behind the decks. It's a spine-tingling affair, building up
        slowly from the skeletal rhythms of Azu Tiwaline and Beatrice Dillon to
        the ecstatic future-garage of Burial's "Truant." One for fans of
        Nono Gigsta
        or Shackleton.

items.title: Cumulus 33 / Mixtape Discos Movimiento #28
items.label: Cio D'or
items.description:
Cio D'or
      

      
        Cumulus 33 / Mixtape Discos Movimiento #28
      
      
        Cio D'or honed her craft in the '90s at legendary Munich club
        Ultraschall before relocating to Cologne to fine-tune her deep, emotive
        take on minimal and dub techno. After temporary retirement due to ill
        health, she has reemerged in tandem with
        dub techno's renaissance
        via a 2024 Draaimolen slot and Kynant Records release. For Mexico City's
        Discos Movimiento, she moves fluidly through records old and new, from
        Basic Channel to René Löwe.

items.title:
FKA Twigs
        –
        Eusexua
items.label: Young
items.description:
Young
      
        FKA Twigs
        –
        Eusexua
      
      
        FKA twigs shines with a quality we haven't really seen before on her
        third studio album, Eusexua. Anchoring her songwriting in the canon of
        '90s dance music, she draws from trip-hop, IDM, electro and living room
        techno, though the LP's best moments reference the darkness of the club.
        While the LP is a response to the liberating euphoria she has
        experienced on the dance floor, the music is no less cerebral than on
        revered full-lengths
        Magdalene
        and
        LP1. There's a gripping seriousness about her devotion to pleasure across
        the album, from the trip-hop poetry on "Girl Feels Good" to the operatic
        runs on "Striptease."
      
      Read the full review

      
        Listen:
        Spotify,
        Apple Music

items.title:
Khadija Al Hanafi –
        !OK!
items.label: Fada Records
items.description:
Fada Records
      
        Khadija Al Hanafi –
        !OK!
      
      
        It's undeniable that footwork, one of Chicago's proudest exports, has
        made its mark around the world, sweeping across the US, the UK, Japan
        and, more recently, Tunisia. Tunisian producer Khadija Al Hanafi's style
        is playful and light-footed, homing in on footwork's soulful elements
        with microbeats that have the glitchy nature of video game music.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Voice Actor,
        Squu
        –
        Lust (1)
items.label: Stroom
items.description:
Stroom
      
        Voice Actor,
        Squu
        –
        Lust (1)
      
      
        Off the back of Voice Actor's 2022 debut,
        Sent From My Telephone, word spread about the enigmatic duo in
        niche dance music circles. Now, they're back with a new offering
        featuring Welsh producer Squu. While previous albums centred abstract
        storytelling over satisfying loops, Lust (1) doubles down on
        repetition, reducing singer Noa Kurzweil's voice to rhythmic murmurs and
        ASMR-like sighs.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp
