items.title:
Ethel Cain –
        Perverts
items.label: Daughters of Cain
items.description:
Daughters of Cain
      
        Ethel Cain –
        Perverts
      
      
        Reluctant popstar Ethel Cain has drawn comparisons to Lana Del Rey with
        her ruminations on shame and longing wrapped up in gloomy Americana. On
        Perverts, she excises her Southern charm, but shifts towards the
        power electronics of Puce Mary. Expect dark ambient, suffocating drone
        and guitars that sound like the Silent Hill alarm disintegrating.
      
      
        Listen:
        Spotify

items.title:
Africanoise
        –
        Cabaça
items.label: Self-Released
items.description:
Self-Released
      
        Africanoise
        –
        Cabaça
      
      
        Africanoise, AKA Renato Junior, is a master of rhythm. His percussive
        instincts are informed by his study of candomblé drumming, which gives
        his modular experiments a ritualistic tenor. Somewhere between jazz,
        candomblé and techno,
        CABAÇA combines these worlds so smoothly you're left wondering
        how they were separate in the first place.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Blacksea Não Maya
        –
        Despertar
items.label: Principe
items.description:
Principe

      
        Blacksea Não Maya
        –
        Despertar
      
      
        Príncipe affiliates Blacksea Não Maya have always favoured more
        sluggish, moodier sounds than their label peers. On their latest
        release, DJ Kolt steps up under the group's alias for an album that
        takes tarraxo's intoxicating rhythm and slows it to a head-nodding pace
        easily likened to trap or trip-hop. Low-down grooves for the body and
        mind.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Radart –
        Blips & Bleeps
items.label: Paper-Cuts
items.description:
Paper-Cuts

      
        Radart –
        Blips & Bleeps
      
      
        For nearly a decade, Naarm (Melbourne)-based label Paper-Cuts has
        specialised in low-slung house, downtempo and ambient techno, counting
        Kia, Roza Terenzi and CS + Kreme among its affiliates. The outlet's
        first release of 2025, Blips & Bleeps, comes from founder Dylan
        Batelic, AKA Radart. The LP is a breezy journey for anyone who enjoys
        melodic loops, lush pads and minimal breaks.
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
Wata Igarashi
        –
        Kaleidoscopic
items.label: Dekmantel UFO
items.description:
Dekmantel UFO

      
        Wata Igarashi
        –
        Kaleidoscopic
      
      
        Tokyo producer Wata Igarashi is known for dealing in the sublime,
        whether through ambient, krautrock-influenced downtempo or lean acid
        techno. Kaleidoscopic closes in on the tougher end of his sound
        while adding the natural sounds of his environment—from crashing waves
        to swooshes of billowing wind. A treat for the senses.
      
      Read the full review

      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title:
HorsegiirL
        –
        vip - very important pony
items.label: Three Six Zero Recordings
items.description:
Three Six Zero Recordings

      
        HorsegiirL
        –
        vip - very important pony
      
      
        horsegiirL's 2022 EP, My Barn, My Rules, launched the Berlin
        producer as an antidote to the more po-faced corners of dance music
        culture. On vip, she adds a layer of sincerity to her exuberant
        blend of Eurodance, UKG and hyperpop, showcasing a pop songwriter's
        touch on "bby luv x3" and "the scene before the kiss xoxo."
      
      
        Listen:
        Bandcamp

items.title: naffcast003
items.label:
Priori,
        Cousin
items.description:
Priori,
        Cousin
      
      
        naffcast003
      
      
        Clocking in at over six hours, this marathon recording from
        Sustain-Release 2024 might take you a couple of sittings to get through
        in full—but it's massively worth it. The expansive session contains too
        many highlights to count, including Ovatow's "Permutation Two," Wamdue
        Project's "Are You High" and a rework of James K's "Hypersoft Lovejinx
        Junkdream." No wonder one commenter declared: "Going to be vibing off
        this for the rest of my life."

items.title: Recorded at Climate of Fear
items.label: DJ Nigga Fox
items.description:
DJ Nigga Fox
      

      
        Recorded at Climate of Fear
      
      
        Climate of Fear has long been one of Berlin's best parties. At the most
        recent edition of the 24-hour warehouse rave, Príncipe affiliate DJ
        Nigga Fox kept the dance floor consistently moving with three hours of
        dark, percussive club energy—plus playful edits of Central Cee's "Doja"
        and Gala's "Freed From Desire" thrown in for good measure.

items.title: .Freq with Mike Servito and Jeffrey Sfire
items.label:
Mike Servito,
        Jeffrey Sfire
items.description:
Mike Servito,
        Jeffrey Sfire
      

      
        .Freq with Mike Servito and Jeffrey Sfire
      
      
        When asked about his approach to DJing, Mike Servito once said, "I don't
        think about it. When I'm playing, I just dive in and I'm OK." He and
        fellow Detroit legend Jeffrey Sfire are regular partners, linking up
        again for this slot on New York's The Lot Radio. The duo are on more
        than OK form, diving into a selection of proto-house and techno with the
        verve and grit that define their shared home city.

items.title: Vision 025
items.label: Courtney Bailey
items.description:
Courtney Bailey
      

      
        Vision 025
      
      
        How do you earn the name "Tokyo Chug Lord"? Just ask Courtney Bailey.
        The Japanese DJ, who got her start throwing warehouse raves on the
        outskirts of Tokyo, now lives in Europe. This recording at Berlin's
        Fitzroy is proof she's deserving of the title—just listen to how
        effortlessly she shifts from transcendental synths to brooding acid
        storms.

items.title: GQOM MIX TAPES E34
items.label: Soulchoke
items.description:
Soulchoke
      
      
        GQOM MIX TAPES E34
      
      
        If this new mix from up-and-coming South African DJ Soulchoke is
        anything to go by, the gqom scene remains in good health, over a decade
        since its global boom. Spinning tunes from the likes of Griffit Vigo,
        Mafia Boyz and KΣITO, the Cape Town artist highlights a rhythmic dance
        movement that continues to evolve in bold and exciting ways.

items.label: Numbers
items.description: Formerly known as Perko, Fergus Jones crafts some of the classiest '90s and early aughts downtempo and ambient you'll hear this fall.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: K7!
items.description: Honey Dijon's DJ-Kicks is an ecstatic house music history lesson, reaching the peaks and valleys of a mammoth rave set with the precision of a Swiss watchmaker.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Young
items.description: After years of tiring tricks and hijinx, Two Shell's first album is surprisingly, refreshingly and successfully clear.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Mais Um Discos
items.description: A year into the Palestinian crisis, the Lebanese duo reflect on the harrowing images on their screens with an album that reaches deep emotional depths by tempering dream pop's sweet-natured reverie with experimental snarl.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: AD 93
items.description: On their second album, the post-hardcore band bring vocalists into their enigmatic, abstract mould. Here, their draw lies not in decontextualisation but in their ability to reassemble new worlds through connection.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Graded
items.description: Midland's debut album is more than just a simple collection of downbeat, sometimes esoteric progressive house and IDM tracks: it's a studied reckoning with queer history and identity.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Sneaker Social Club
items.description: Low End Activist has dedicated much of his career to producing heads-down, semi-biographical bass music inspired by his childhood growing up in the Blackbird Leys estate in Oxford, UK. This time, his excellent patchwork of samples, contorted bass and dark ambient focus centres on a three-day Blackbird Leys riot in 1991.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Relapse Records
items.description: The British producer strips and slows the beat down to see how deep he can go on this compilation of EPs he played out frequently at Pressure, his sound system party series.Listen:Bandcamp

items.text: Charli xcx - Brat and it's completely different but also still brat
items.label: Atlantic Records
items.description: As we say goodbye to brat summer, Charli revamps her hit record with a star-studded thesis statement on fame—with a close-to-heart director's cut. Listen:Apple

items.text: Dawn Richard & Spencer Zahn - Quiet in a World Full of Noise
items.label: Merge Records
items.description: Dawn Richards's raw, naked voice sings against the sparse backdrop of Spencer Zahn's piano, telling multi-faceted confessions of generational trauma ultimately grounded in the anticipation of healing.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Dh2
items.description: On her fourth album, Kelly Lee Owens brings listeners away from the topography of her home country, Wales, and into the flashy, hands-in-the-air world of superclubs.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Central Processing Unit
items.description: The FM Tapes, written as a tribute to the Yamaha DX7, is a refined marriage of the conceptual and the functional. The result is some of the best electro Maelstrom has produced in the past decade.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Príncipe
items.description: Known for his romance-infused batida, DJ Lycox turns to R&B and pop to masterfully tread the line between the rambunctious edge of early Príncipe producers and the emotional style of the genre's new school.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: mb studio
items.description: Toma Kami's debut album balances emotion and detail, full of bright and precise melodies, sweeping pads and rhythms that sway from head-nodding reggaeton to tunnelling breaks.Listen:Bandcamp

items.text: Virtual Dreams II: Ambient Explorations In The House & Techno Age, Japan 1993​-​1999
items.label: Music From Memory
items.description: Music From Memory's first compilation of ambient music from the mid-to-late '90s gets a brilliant follow-up, with this edition focussing on genre-defining artists in Japan.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: False Aralia
items.description: Peak Oil cofounder Brian Foote and Izaak Schlossman launch their new label, False Aralia, with an EP of fuzzy dub techno reminiscent of the delicate intricacy of a Topdown Dialectic album.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Kapsela
items.description: The promising follow-up to another excellent release that minted Objekt's new label, Kapsela, Chicken Garaage is dark, slung garage that comes with all of the micro details you'd expect from the Berlin-based producer.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Method 808
items.description: yunè pinku's latest record brings her laser-filled garage and techno influences to a smoky chillout room.Listen:Apple

items.label: Club Romantico
items.description: Spanning electro breaks, hoover sound, jungle and reggaeton, Amuleto is representative of the propulsive sounds the Madrid producer has absorbed while touring Latin America and the States.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Kaizen
items.description: On her debut EP, Madam X pays tribute to her Greek and UK heritage through collaborations with Andy Martin, DJ JM, Cartridge and Doctor Jeep. The result is four full-throttle tracks that don't skimp on the bass.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Upsammy
items.description: This two-hour recording of upsammy at Portugal's Waking Life festival in June is a spellbinding trip from zero to 100. Rhythmic techno and electro at its very best.

items.label: Steffi
items.description: Christmas came early this month when Dekmantel dropped 70-plus recordings from their mammoth tenth edition in August. From the many excellent sets, this one from Steffi is a highlight. Closing out the Selectors stage, she went deep, dramatic and driving, moving through house, techno and electro in quintessentially Steffi style.

items.label: Dj Popup
items.description: Since the mid-'10s, some of the best house music has consistently been coming out of Denmark, courtesy of the Regelbau crew in Aarhus.NES label head DJ Popup is continuing this legacy for the 2020s. The Copenhagen-based DJ puts together 70 minutes of deep house for the Mexican mix series Esencia, channeling vintage New York house and the hazy pads of Vancouver, with hints of UK garage.

items.label: Sam Goku
items.description: Sam Goku lays down an excellent 90 minutes for the latest mix in the Far Blue series. Balancing various textures without sacrificing depth and groove, it's one that's equally suited to home listening and the club."I recorded this mix right after I came back from my Asia tour," the Chinese-German artist wrote on SoundCloud. "Maybe it reflects the serenity I [felt] after returning from an inspiring trip-I felt very unrushed while recording it. What I also took home from this trip is a renewed fascination for textures of all kinds, which gave this mix its name. I hope you enjoy."

items.label: DJ Frog
items.description: Running parties and releasing music on Doo Records, DJ Frog is a local legend of the Montreal scene. It's not hard to see why: for the latest edition of Pascale Project's new mix series, Sparkling, she delivers a vinyl-only hour of crunchy minimal house and techno, closing out with the timeless "Planet Be (Hashman deejay remix)". One for any fan of Acting Press or PLO Man.

items.label: Soria
items.description: An hour of sprawling, dubbed-out soundscapes on the latest Swoon podcast, courtesy of Dublin-via-Berlin DJ Soria.As noted in the description, the mix is inspired "by the main character from 'A Spy in the House of Love' by Anais Nin. Here the protagonist bathes at night in moonlight as one would in the sun, cultivating a power from its rays which pulls in and frightens the other characters around her. A reminder of the strength we have when we allow ourselves access to our own sensuality."

items.label: Andy Martin & Sarcus Soundsystem
items.description: Guadalajara-based favourite Andy Martin and the Parisian trio Sarcus Soundsystem take the reins of the dependably sick Dub Delights show on Rinse France. The result: two hours of dub-adjacent sounds, from Tikiman to Dubamine.

items.label: Mike Servito & Jeffrey Sifre
items.description: Of the many events across Movement weekend, Return to the Source makes for a consistent highlight. International Transmissions leads the event series encompassing parties like No Way Back and The Bunker, the latter of which hosted Mike Servito and Jeffrey Sfire earlier this year."Mike Servito always majestically closes out No Way Back, but what would this combination bring? Sfire brought the heat, and their styles melded in a slightly pitched-down form, music from all eras appeared," No Way Back cofounder BMG wrote of the duo's The Bunker mix on Instagram. "A magical closing set that naturally extended from two hours to five hours of pure heat from two DJs whose whole [lives are] this music and this culture—who could ask for more?"

items.label: Imbalance Computer Music
items.description: The tenth Monolake album is Robert Henke's best in a decade. Most refreshing is that after a slew of academic-leaning releases, it sounds like he's finally having fun.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Soundway Records
items.description: UK-based, Bahraini-born childhood friends Mazen AlMaskati and Vish Matre have long been on a journey to archive and safeguard the music that reminds them of home—with their own twist. On their self-titled debut album, they accomplish this so well that you'd be forgiven for thinking it was a reissue, not something released in 2024.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Latency
items.description: Two percussionists from vastly different sonic worlds meet up, and the results are astounding. Valentina Magaletti brings a warm human element to Nídia's sharp kuduro.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Warp
items.description: On Nala Sinephro's long-awaited second album, she transforms the glossy ambient-jazz that debuted on Space 1.8. This time, she hollows out the rich, meandering curvatures of jazz to land on isolated arpeggios that share more in common with ambient.Listen:Bandcamp

items.text: Various - Dekmantel Ten: A Decade of Dekmantel Festival
items.label: Dekmantel
items.description: One of Europe's most respected festivals celebrates ten years with DJs inseparable from the event, with uneven results.Listen:Bandcamp

items.text: Tim Reaper & Kloke - In Full Effect
items.label: Hyperdub
items.description: Hyperdub's first jungle album in 20 years lands with an expected bang. Two revered new-generation producers team up and unsurprisingly deliver.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Ninja Tune
items.description: After years of putting out jazz-electronica fusion, Floating Points returns to straight-forward, technicolour dance floor tracks.Listen:Bandcamp

items.text: Sarah Davachi - The Head As Formm'd In The Crier's Choir
items.label: Late Music
items.description: One of the most ubiquitous Greek myths, Orpheus, is reimagined through Sarah Davachi's foreboding drone work, unlocking an even deeper emotional resonance in her compositions.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Because Music
items.description: On his debut album, LSDXOXO, a producer who once banked on the success of his raunchy edits, makes his pop star transformation. Cleverly inverting early to mid-'00s pop motifs, he gives his sexy, unbridled production a clear running narrative.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Atlantic Records
items.description: The gorgeous lead single for the avant-pop star's new album mimics the sensation of a rising heartbeat: smooth, throbbing and desperate to breach the ribs and touch muscle to skin.Listen:Apple

items.label: XL Recordings
items.description: Hong Kong producer gyrofield combines peculiar, miniscule parts to give their flawless drum & bass EP a distinct, off-world soundscape.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: Still Music
items.description: A reissue of a propulsive, gritty 12-inch from Richie Weeks' Jiraffe alias serves as a mini time capsule of his ever-evolving artistic practice.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: 禁 JIN
items.description: Four tracks of aqueous house and techno that bottle the emotional expansiveness and cruising pace of Cosmo's DJ sets, full of understated acid tinges and sparkling melodies that land with impact despite their airiness.Listen:Bandcamp

items.label: CCL
items.description: Until this year, CCL had never played the mythical UK festival Freerotation—hard to believe, right? Luckily, the esteemed selector's 90-minute debut was recorded, joining Animalia's vaunted mix series."Playing one of the first sets and seeing the room, decor and the big bad subs of Room 2, years of fantastical lore and reality melded, I wanted to keep it sexy, wonky, trippy," they wrote. "Imagining a psychic electric swamp and how one would levitate through it... to the sky."

items.label: Rachael
items.description: Originally from Zaragoza, Rachael is a favourite across Spain's underground scene. This stomping two-hour, all-vinyl set shows the Madrid-based DJ in excellent form. Recorded live at Jaleo Real, an intimate festival outside the capital, she moves through techno, breakbeat and hard house (including a killer rework of Brandy's "I Wanna Be Down") with pace and ease. One for any Eris Drew or Angel D'lite fan.

items.label: Samurai Breaks
items.description: The prolific UK producer and SUPER SONIC BOOTY BANGERS boss goes all in from the off in this live recording from The Cause, spinning 38 fast and freaky tunes in just over an hour. Proper Saturday night material.

items.label: Aaron J
items.description: With appearances at Draaimolen, Sustain-Release and Paral·lel, Aaron J is one of techno's best-kept secrets. This session from the 2024 edition of Above Below shows exactly why, balancing introspective records with abstract textures and subtle drive.

items.label: Bennet
items.description: Berlin-based event series Multisex is an unabashed house music affair. Hannover-based DJ Bennet steps up for the latest edition of its mix series, perfectly capturing the party's steamy atmosphere, moving through everything from elegant dubbed-out cuts to floor-filling progressive material, all on vinyl.

items.label: Ben UFO
items.description: No one does it quite like Ben. In this live set from Sustain-Release 2023, the Hessle Audio mastermind is in peak form, flowing effortlessly through the many shades of speed garage, wiggly tech house and wonky techno. His impeccable ear shines as he weaves together the summer anthems of 2023 and 2024—Theo Kottis’s "Lighthouse," Pangaea’s "Installation" and Peverlist's "Pulse VII"—making them feel both refreshingly new and warmly familiar.

items.text: BFC Summer in the City 2024 @ Der Hintergarten
items.label: Ciel & Priori
items.description: This June, Ciel and Priori went back-to-back at the Breakfast Club in Amsterdam. The result: a near-three-hour recording that's equal parts deep, bumping and squelchy, moving through trance, tech house and bass-heavy techno with ease.

items.label: Miscmeg
items.description: Melbourne mainstay Miscmeg steps up to New York's premier radio station, delivering an hour of romping minimal and blissful, bleepy tech house.

items.label: Warp
items.description:
The experimental band's first extended release in 13 years doesn't feel like a band trading on their reputation—the initial impression is one of change. Everything Squared finds Mark Clifford zeroing in on his production process while Sarah Peacock's vocals continue to provide a crucial human quality to the band's reliably enigmatic sound.
    
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.label: Nice Life records
items.description:
Outside the brief flirtations on Quantum Baby's singles—including of course, the viral hit "Nasty"—Tinashe's seventh album is really about striving for authenticity. The 22-minute album leans toward the hazy, subdued end of her catalogue, while still delivering on the kind of smoky, sexy numbers that we'd expect from her.
        
    Listen:
    Apple

items.text: Kampire - Kampire Presents: A Dancefloor in Ndola
items.label: Strut
items.description:
Kampire has helped champion envelope-pushing East and South African music from the '70s up to the present day. On her debut compilation, she steps into the role of curator proper. A Dancefloor in Ndola is a captivating exercise in crate-diggery, setting renowned heavyweights like Samba Mapangala and Tshala Muana next to unpolished gems with gritty production values, party-ready grooves and minimal Google footprints.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.label: Incienso
items.description:
Huerco S. brings back his Loidis alias on One Day, a stripped-back record that shows the producer falling back in love with the art of a simple loop. Across eight tracks, he writes deep, muted and wobbly rhythms filled with the sort of gorgeous dub techno melodicism you might hear on a Shinichi Atobe record.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.label: Sacred Bones
items.description:
Across Cellophane Memories's 37 minutes, the pair's longstanding creative chemistry takes a new and arresting shape. Stripped of burdensome song forms and almost entirely absent of beats or easy melodies, something genuinely mysterious emerges—a mystery you'd be tempted to describe as "Lynchian" even without knowing who was behind it.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.label: Domino
items.description:
Jon Hopkins began his journey making "serious, emotional" music with 2021's hazy, beatless Music For Psychedelic Therapy. The follow-up to that album, Ritual, originated from music Hopkins wrote for an installation called Dreamachine, named after a 1959 invention heralded as "the first art object to be seen with eyes closed." The 41-minute composition expands into eight parts that unfurl like a guided meditation.
        
    Listen:
    Apple

items.label: Nonesuch
items.description:
When Laurie Anderson—who first conceived of Amelia as a stage performance 24 years ago—was asked on BBC Radio 4 why Amelia Earhart's story appealed to her, the answer was simple: "She was a bad-girl pilot—and I liked that." On the LP, Anderson follows the late pilot's final flight path. The album plays like an audio documentary, drawing directly from Earhart's writing and strapping us into the plane with Earhart with shaky, surround-sound instrumentation.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.label: Time Passages
items.description:
A decade is a long time in dance music, but longevity looks good on the techno label Time Passages. On the anniversary compilation, Binh's label remains the high watermark for low-slung and sinister minimal electro and techno.
        
    Listen:
    SoundCloud

items.label: Play:Musik
items.description:
On the first release in 14 years on Play:Musik, Nectax brings the same shapeshifting energy of the label's early output. Across four slickly produced tracks, he connects elements of footwork, jungle, techno and hardcore on an impressively varied EP that vividly reimagines the sonic kinship between those genres.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.text: Danny Daze & Jonny From Space - Tumbadora EP
items.label: Craigie Knowles
items.description:
On Tumbadora, Danny Daze and Jonny From Space reunite for an EP that swaps the introspection of their respective debut albums for three original cuts of sludgy, polyrhythmic electro and techno. It even includes a cameo from Miami's other wunderkind, Nick León.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.label: NAFF
items.description:
On Tilda's Goat Stare, Ciel & CCL's debut collaboration's chaotic feminist streak found a fitting anchor in the 2002 sci-fi feminist film Teknolust. Much of the EP lands with a thwack, top-loaded with precisely the kind of dusty peak-time tracks you'd find in the duo's festival sets.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.label: Rare Earth Tones
items.description:
Over a decade since Dubbel Dutch's last solo release, one of the breakthrough stars of the post-dubstep bubble returns after literally going off the grid. Cosmic Tone Poems is built around the contrast between synth lines that float like champagne bubbles and basslines that plunge the tracks down to earth, updating the sort of genre promiscuity he championed in the '10s.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.label: XL Recordings
items.description:
The producer makes their debut on XL with a dynamic EP inspired by a night out in Bristol. Over four tracks, they swerve from angular acidlines to delectable, sputtering drum & bass breaks.
        
    Listen:
    Bandcamp

items.text: All Arthur Russell DJ set, live at The Barbican
items.label: JD Twitch
items.description: Optimo's JD Twitch dives into Arthur Russell's vast catalogue for this live recording at London's Barbican Centre back in May, celebrating the late composer's extraordinary life.

items.label: Mattias El Mansouri
items.description: For the 428th GROOVE Podcast, Stockholm-based DJ and producer Mattias El Mansouri delivers a stellar two-hour mix, traversing eclectic boogies from the likes of The Durutti Column and Barrington Levy to the deep minimal rhythms of Arkajo and Dorisburg.

items.label: Assyouti
items.description: The Berlin-based producer and DJ goes tear-out, spinning hard-as-nails choppage from the likes of Breakage, B-Key and Champa B. If you like your drum & bass dark and weighty, this one's for you.

items.label: Ploy
items.description: While he may have initially made his name releasing wonky bassbin tracks on the likes of Hessle Audio, Timedance and Hemlock, Ploy isn't one to be pinned down. On the July edition of his Rinse FM show, the Bristol-based DJ and producer demonstrates that he's equally comfortable (and excellent) at playing house.

items.text: Freerotation 2024 : The House Of Crocodiles Part 2 (Live Recording)
items.label: Nono Gigsta
items.description: No rhythm, tempo or genre is off limits in this truly ecstatic and goosebump-inducing set, recorded live at Freerotation from Cashmere Radio resident Nono Gigsta. Oh and there's not one but two Björk moments—enjoy.

items.label: DJ Maria
items.description: With regular appearances at Berghain, Bassiani and VENT, DJ MARIA. is one of the best DJs to emerge out of Japan in recent years.Guesting on Kiosk Radio, the Tokyo-based artist delivers a masterclass in building atmosphere, perfectly balancing muscle with texture (including one particularly mind-bending transition in which it sounds like she mixes a field recording from a working kitchen into Ben Klock's "Wolf"). It's the kind of eye-opening session that makes you want to listen to all her other mixes right after.

items.label: Objekt
items.description: Objekt is one of the most dynamic artists in underground techno today, and this recording—from the equally influential New York club Nowadays—captures him on typically excellent form."I played on Sunday morning from 9 AM to 3 PM, between JASSS and Bearcat," he said, calling it "one of the most creatively fulfilling sets I can remember playing–one of those sets where the audience, environment, atmosphere, tech setup, phase of the moon, whatever, all somehow lined up for a full six hours."

items.label: Sarkawt Hamad
items.description: The versatile Amsterdam-based DJ covers a lot of ground in this two-hour live recording from Down The Rabbit Hole. You can hear her adventurous approach in full bloom, moving through starry-eyed house, hypnotic techno, squelchy acid and more from the likes of Peach, Polygonia and Zephyr.

items.label: Love On The Rocks
items.description:
Groovy enough for the heads, loud enough for the club—PARAMIDA's label turns ten with a typically high-class compilation.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: Leaving Records
items.description:
Soothing ambient odes to the wilderness of Argentina.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.text: British Murder Boys - Active Agents and House Boys
items.label: Downwards
items.description:
Regis and Surgeon's debut album after two decades together fine-tunes their live sets into a dubby, post-punk snarl.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.text: Iceboy Violet & Nueen - You Said You'd Hold My Hand Through The Fire
items.label: Hyperdub
items.description:
The Manchester rapper and producer debuts on Hyperdub with a corrosive ambient break-up album.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
An immersive and intricate take on bedroom R&B built from a lush array of early '00s pop and nods to the softer sides of the UK hardcore continuum. 

Listen:
Spotify / Apple

items.label: Obligated Records
items.description:
This album shows what grime actually is, in all its different forms—two sides of the same rough-edged coin with techno.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Smalltown Supersound
items.description:
Statik rolls back Actress's recent free jazz curveballs and corrugated hip-hop beats to focus on windblown hiss and radio interference for a sense of uneasy calm.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple

items.label: RCA
items.description:
Kaytranada delivers his most exciting, upbeat record yet, a sexy dance odyssey at the intersection of R&B, hip-hop, pop and soul.

Listen:
Spotify / Apple

items.label: Atlantic Records
items.description:
Brash, confident and proudly messy, Charli XCX's clubbiest album is also her most vulnerable—and best.

Listen:
Spotify / Apple

items.label: Never Normal Records
items.description:
​​The Never Normal Records boss drops a sizzling mixtape of tracks old and new just in time for the summer.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: Tresor
items.description:
Carhartt WIP and Tresor team up for an EP that highlights the past, present and future of the unique, enduring Detroit-Berlin connection.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: Timedance
items.description:
The TraTraTrax cofounder gets bigger and bolder on his debut for Timedance.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: all my thoughts
items.description:
Part hyperpop, part weirdo club, part easy listening—the Salamanda cofounder operates in a world of her own.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Carrier
items.description:
With Carrier, Guy Brewer looks back to his formative drum & bass years and rebuilds those sounds in a creative, and wizened, way.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: AMF
items.description:
In just under five minutes, Boo builds a hypnotic techno soundscape where softness intertwines with grit. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple

items.label: Nous'klaer Audio
items.description:
A lowkey German lifer turns in a surprising record of emotional and dramatic techno for Nous'klaer Audio.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: ec2a
items.description:
Across four tracks, the trio find an unexpected sweet spot between 2-step and reggaeton.  

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.text: Gene On Earth - The Velvet Edge
items.label: Limousine Dream
items.description:
The American producer is taking on the big room without compromising his commitment to the funkiest—and weirdest—corners of dance music history.  

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Naafi
items.description:
Hazy drum & bass-techno hybridism on N.A.A.F.I.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Spazio Disponible
items.description:
The French producer continues to drift away from peak time with an EP of beautiful and intricate ambient techno.  

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify

items.label: Nathalie Seres
items.description: Panorama Bar resident Nathalie Seres puts together a wonderfully paced Bazaar mix that starts out house and gets wobbly and bouncy from there, climaxing with Pangaea's "Installation."

items.label: BFTT
items.description: Manchester DJ BFTT dropped an exclusive mix for RA called Take It Higher, blending tried-and-true club classics with cutting-edge UK dance music, plus tracks from Dj Babatr, Ben Sims, Lemon D and others.

items.label: Gbenga
items.description: The multidisciplinary artist and Serenity Link resident joins Los Angeles rave and mix series Extasy, delivering an hour of barrelling techno, trance and reggaeton-inflected club edits, including their own rework of JT's "Okay."

items.label: Daria Kolosova
items.description: The Lutugino-born DJ is one of the post-pandemic era's breakout stars, with frequent appearances at Awakenings, Berghain and Bassiani. For the first show in her NTS Radio residency, she steps up for an hour of what she does best: heavy-hitting techno on an old-school tip, including a barreling rework of M.I.A's "Bucky Done Gun."

items.label: JS Alvarez
items.description:
<

The Podlasie resident steps up for the latest instalment of the Detroit podcast and event series Neptunian Influence, delivering a hefty 90-minute mix of sub-heavy rollers, mutant percussion and post-apocalyptic electro.

items.label: Calibre
items.description: Spanning 90 minutes of dubstep, UK garage and drum & bass, this live recording from last year's Waterworks Festival in London perfectly sums up Calibre's signature soulful sound.

items.label: JWY
items.description: Dublin-based DJ and Foxgluv founder JWY delivers the goods on the second instalment of the GMIX SERIES. With propulsive tracks from the likes of Amor Satyr and Ulterior Motive, it might make you reconsider a quiet night in.

items.label: Fortunato
items.description: For the third edition of Mariposa's programme linking artists in the Global South, the Colombian collective invites Brazilian producer and DJ Fortunato for an hour of pumping techno, electro and Jersey club.

items.label: Fafi Abdel Nour
items.description: Running the gamut from old-school techno to tech house, with plenty of sultry vocals along the way, this two-hour recording is from the Amsterdam festival's 2024 edition.

items.label: Chucheewa
items.description: The Bangkok-based DJ, singer and instrumentalist delivers a steady stream of groovy house cuts for Brussels' Kiosk Radio, from some old-school Green Velvet and Jex Opolis to Alex Kassian's rendition of Manuel Göttsching's "E2-E4."

items.label: NAFF
items.description:
Combining his knack for hi-def production values, club music and world-building, the Montreal producer's newest album is a home-listening home run.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: BBE
items.description:
In the handsome company of collaborators old and new, the New York duo reflect on the intricacies of the Black experience on their tremendously musical debut album.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: fabric Records
items.description:
The UK singer, rapper, songwriter and producer shows off her DJing skills on a bright and upbeat fabric instalment.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: 3XL
items.description:
A sweeping collection of dream pop, ambient and shoegaze with assistance from Erika de Casier, Shy and Huerco S.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Warp Records
items.description:
This gripping set of demos outlines what Broadcast's unfinished last album could have been, with all the brilliance of the duo's more polished work intact.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.text: L.B. Dub Corp - Saturn to Home
items.label: Dekmantel
items.description:
From disco to dub, Luke Slater still makes dance music like no one else—this time with a live drum kit.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Bubbletease Communications
items.description:
Maurice Fulton's jam band returns with their strangest, spaciest and most singular record to date. 

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Domino
items.description:
The Portishead frontwoman turns to spectral folk music on her solo debut album, exploring loss, ageing and grief.

Listen:
Spotify / Apple

items.label: Ninja Tune
items.description:
A breathless and emotional LP about self-actualisation and community through the language of belting house music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: Livity Sound
items.description:
Pev goes house here, but he also goes hard, with some of his most deceptively complex music yet. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple

items.label: Uppers and Downers
items.description:
Two and a half acid rippers on a stunning debut from the revered techno DJ, who also inaugurates her own label.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.text: Tongue in the Mind - Tongue in the Mind
items.label: PAN
items.description:
Seizing on a wave of rock music in clubland, Juliana Huxtable's new band with Jealous Orgasm and Via App is as excellent as you'd expect it to be.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: YCO
items.description:
The YCO cofounder's club beats get bigger, brawnier and more extreme on this captivating new EP. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: Peach Discs
items.description:
From the disintegrating disco chords on "Catfished" to the EBM flirtation on "Vampire Heart," these are Saoirse's edgiest tech house cuts to date. 

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Aus Music
items.description:
The Wisdom Teeth boss lands on Aus Music with quirky house and UK garage.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.text: Demdike Stare x Dolo Percussion - DOLO DS
items.label: DDS
items.description:
Max D and Demdike Stare come together for three tracks of drum wizardry that have the power to change the way you think about rhythm.

Listen:
Youtube

items.label: Ambie—Tón
items.description:
TraTraTrax starts a new ambient label with a record of beautiful textures and hazy cumbia rhythms.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple

items.label: Detroit Underground
items.description:
The Detroit producer's take on acid is both faithful and irreverent, which makes Bónus a solid EP for anyone who needs some new old-fashioned squelch.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Ella Knight & Jeremy Sylvester
items.description: Ella Knight and Jeremy Sylvester joined forces at The Modern Funktion party at The Cause in London and this is the result: 90 minutes of old-school house and UK garage heat.

items.label: Raf Reza
items.description: A deep dive into the Asian underground of the late '90s.

items.label: INVT & Skee Mask
items.description: American duo INVT went head-to-head (to head) with Skee Mask in Berlin in April, throwing down a thrilling collision of electro, techno, garage tech house and more.

items.label: dameeeela
items.description:
<

The Brisbane-based DJ and radio host dameeeela doesn't let energy levels drop once during her gangbusters Meredith Music Festival set. Pummelling through ravey techno, explosive acid and dizzying breaks, she plays to win.

items.label: Kilbourne
items.description: Kilbourne is in top, tough form on this nearly three-hour recording from Hammerhead's first anniversary party in New York, featuring a ton of her own tracks. It's not for the faint of heart—but it is for the adventurous.

items.label: bastiengoat
items.description: bastiengoat—Oakland's expert in edits and club tracks—lays down a UK-centric set encompassing garage, breaks, drum & bass and more on this Lucid Radio set, including a welcome airing of Pearson Sound's "Untitled."

items.label: Cashu
items.description: Cashu shines on this Dekmantel mix, which leaps between boisterous percussive sections and heart-in-mouth breakdowns, anchored by plenty of huge basslines.

items.label: Four Tet
items.description: A two-and-a-half-hour recording of the maestro playing his own festival underneath a bridge in New York.

items.label: Lyo XS
items.description: Lyo XS appears on Mexico City series Lapi + Filia with a wonderful 40 minutes of "fusions of deconstructed ambient, noise and pop—a mix for her inner fairy."

items.label: Arca
items.description: Arca returned to her homeland of Venezuela in March for Boiler Room's Caracas debut with a typically out-there set that showcases her mix of pop and experimental instincts perfectly.

items.label: Morph Tracks
items.description:
What techno sounds like to Leonce: intricate, funky and out of this world, rooted in a refreshing and deceptive simplicity.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Perc Trax
items.description:
Perc's fourth album shrouds his fire and brimstone techno in post-punk gloom.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Sferic
items.description:
A bewitching mixture of sound collage, post-punk and avant-garde music with incisive lyrics.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify

items.label: HIJINXX
items.description:
UK jungle's brightest young hope presents an infectious blend of heavy breaks and deep introspection. 

Listen:
Apple

items.label: Planet Mu
items.description:
This thrilling fusion of classical and electronic music is the best record yet from the reigning champ of experimental footwork.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify

items.text: Various - Lost Paradise: Blissed Out Breakbeat Hardcore 1991​-​94
items.label: Blank Mind
items.description:
An eye-opening compilation that highlights the happier side of the rave movement that coalesced into jungle and drum & bass.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify

items.label: Thrill Jockey
items.description:
The Canadian-American sound collagist pairs idyllic soundscapes with sincere, emo-influenced Autotuned vocal performances.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Subtext
items.description:
A traditional Korean music called pansori inspires this gorgeously grotesque, industrial-influenced folk album.

Listen:

In other words, classic, but still new.

items.description: Richie Hawtin shared ten of his favourite recent live recordings, including this ripping closing set from Time Warp 2023. It's modern Hawtin at his best: powerful, intricate and precise.

items.description: According to DJ Spit, his Crack Mix is all about "futuristic energy and laid-back breaky rhythms to make your seasonal adventures even more memorable."

<

DJ Pipe is behind some of the grooviest, swingiest house records around, but you won't find much in the way of his DJing online. Enter GHOSTCAST 019, which is full of bump and flex.

items.text: Chris Korda - Not My Problem, I'll Be Dead
items.label: Yoyaku
items.description:
This EP is as musical as it is political, ironically sugar-coating Korda's climate apocalypse diatribes in bursts of dance floor colour.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: Hudson Mohawke & Nikki Nair - Set The Roof
items.label: Warp Records
items.description:
Zany cross-genre club music from two of dance music's most distinctive voices.  

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Blueprint Records
items.description:
Irish producer Kerrie is a great match for Blueprint—both are reliable sources of bona fide, no-bullshit techno.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Steel City Dance Discs
items.description:
Another big tune on Mall Grab's Steel City Dance Discs, this time built around a Mariah Carey sample.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Beyond The Bridge
items.description:
Who needs melody when you let the drums do the talking? Spekki Webu's debut solo EP features some truly mind-boggling, full-bore trance.

Listen:
Bandcamp / SoundCloud

items.label: Lakuti
items.description: Lakuti helms a special Pride edition of the fabric podcast, presenting an hour of typically joyous grooves that bridge vintage disco, house, hi-NRG and other '80s and '90s flavours.

items.label: Helena Hauff & Moopie
items.description: Two idiosyncratic and brilliant selectors come together for one hell of a back-to-back, recorded live in Melbourne.

items.label: Nicolas Lutz
items.description: Here's three hours of Nicolas Lutz live at last year's Houghton, when he closed the Pavilion Stage from 5 through 8 AM on Sunday morning.

items.label: Paula Temple
items.description: Who needs a morning cuppa when you have this blistering Awakenings set from Paula Temple? To put it simply, she absolutely goes for it.

items.label: MJK
items.description: London DJ MJK is on fire on this Ilian Tape Podcast, with an on-point style that bridges the gap between old-school dubstep and more contemporary UK techno.

items.label: Jubilee
items.description: The Magic City label boss hits all the sweet spots in this rollicking mix: Latin percussion, hints of UK funky, Miami bass and electro. Listen out for her new pop-inflected rave cut, "Delete," which riffs off everybody's favourite phone jingle.

items.label: Quest
items.description: If you don't already know Quest (IT), then this is a great introduction. Loaded with obscure IDM, techno and electro, this mix from the Italian DJ zig-zags in all sorts of directions, keeping you on your toes with banger after banger.

items.label: Carista
items.description: This SónarMix shows United Identities founder Carista in fine form, rolling through booming techno and groovy house at a party marking her hometown Utrecht's 900th birthday—you can't say that every day.

items.label: Samuel Kerridge
items.description: Samuel Kerridge's new sets are a hybrid of playing live and DJing—in his words, comprising "hundreds of tracks taken apart into single elements, loaded into a sampler and then remixed and reassembled in a live performance."

items.text: Crack: Sounds From The French Underground
items.label: FIONA
items.description: Parisian DJ FIONA dives deep into "sounds from the French underground" on this Crack mix, including names like Simo Cell, GREG and Anetha.

items.label: Kompakt
items.description:
A sprawling epic of Krautrock, electronica and ambient that establishes the Japanese producer as a talent far beyond the world of techno.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.text: Stefana Fratila - I want to leave this Earth behind
items.label: Not Not Fun Records x Halocline Trance
items.description:
An album of haunting synth music made with custom VST plugins created by Fratila in collaboration with NASA. They're meant to replicate the atmospheres of each planet in our solar system.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: XL Recordings
items.description:
Overmono make a leap for the mainstream with their long-awaited debut album, which ups the ante when it comes to melody, hooks and all things pop.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Planet Mu
items.description:
A moody, footwork-infused reflection on what it's like to live in a city with a history of disasters.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Príncipe
items.description:
Punch-drunk batida that takes the Príncipe sound somewhere a lot more introspective.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: Mr. G - Pearls Don't Lay On The Shore
items.label: Childhood
items.description:
Mr. G strays far from the funky tech house that made him a household name, plunging instead into a delightful abyss.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Modularz
items.description:
Los Angeles' hardest-working producer turns in an album of eerie hardgroove with just the right amount of funk.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: TYGAPAW - love has never been a popular movement.
items.label: fabric Originals
items.description:
The talented New York producer searches for love and meaning in the thrum of techno.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Nhac Gãy

Melancholy textures fuse with home-grown influences on the Vietnamese quintet's second album, which is rooted in the band's cutting, improvised origins. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / SoundCloud

items.label: Step Ball Chain
items.description:
Maara's debut full-length carries on her sensuous world-building, swapping prog and trance for downtempo and drum & bass.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: L.I.E.S.
items.description:
The 200th release on L.I.E.S. gets down to what it's all about: raw, jacking house music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Local Action x Clasico (UK)
items.description:
Coffintexts brings together vintage techno and UK bass with the polyrhythmic heat of Miami club music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Hessle Audio
items.description:
The surefire summer hit isn't your usual R&B flip—the vocals compete with a Eurodance-style synth lead, like a Hessle Audio edit of Vengaboys.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Live At Robert Johnson
items.description:
Rich, ambient-leaning techno for fans of Voices From The Lake and Wata Igarashi.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Stereotone Records
items.description:
A triumphant cut that captures the illusion of its title: churning, psychedelic club music that feels like it's coming at you hard from all angles.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: T4T LUV NRG
items.description:
A playful, retro-minded record that channels the chaotic energy of Eris Drew's Motherbeat from across the Atlantic.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Unknown to the Unknown
items.description:
Elisa Bee nods to old-school Chicago jack and UK rave on four hard-hitting, chrome-plated cuts of contemporary techno.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Astral Black
items.description:
This time around, the sounds of Planet J are deeper and darker takes on jungle and garage, conjuring the image of a catastrophic world crisis.  

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Numbers
items.description:
Half club and half ambient, Perko delivers his best work yet alongside Cucina Povera and Huerco S.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Metroplex
items.description:
On his latest EP as OCB, Driss Bennis perfects the blend of booty-shaking funk and wistful daydreaming for legendary label Metroplex.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify

items.text: The Purge Of Tomorrow - The Other Side Of Devastation
items.label: Modern Obscure Music
items.description:
Shackleton touches on dark ambient, modern classical and other new styles with his signature brilliance.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Laurel Halo
items.description: Here's Laurel Halo in DJ mode, closing out Nowadays for Aurora Halal's residency earlier this month. It's full of groovy house, precocious breakbeats and leftfield club music, as per usual.

items.label: Mika Vainio
items.description: OK, it's not a mix, but it's a fantastic live recording of the late sound artist performing at Japan's rural festival in 2016.

items.label: Zarina
items.description: Brooklyn-based DJ (and 8 Ball Radio member) Zarina delivers a fun, propulsive mix meant to capture the "hypnotic stillness, textured reflection and wacky celebration leading up to Eid."

items.label: Mantra
items.description: Rupture boss Mantra is in fine style on this Ilian Tape Podcast, cycling through drum & bass sub-genres with a light touch.

items.label: Bitter Babe
items.description: Bitter Babe, one of the Miami scene's brightest lights, excels on the latest Dekmantel Podcast. You can hear her poly-genre approach in full bloom, with all kinds of funky, volatile drum patterns jumping constantly between places, regions and styles.

items.label: Yoshi Nori
items.description: Taiwanese-Japanese DJ Yoshi Nori launches his label's new mix series by recombining sounds from his sets at Bangkok's Karma Krachao and Taipei's Organik Festival into one propulsive, 78-minute jaunt.

items.label: Rose Kourts
items.description: "This is a free-flowing power hour of tracks and records I've been digging lately," said the US DJ. "It's eclectic and funky, full of energy and crunchy, groovy, acid-heavy sounds that get my heart pumping, feet stomping and stank face going."

items.label: Piezo
items.description:
<

Piezo's woozy style of club music is the perfect match for Australian crew Animalia's psychedelic MO. In other words, this mix is an absolute knockout.

items.label: rRoxymore
items.description: rRoxymore puts together a dance floor-leaning mix that captures the unique energy of her productions: dubby, techy, with a hint of electro and just off-kilter enough.

items.label: Juke Bounce Werk (DJ Noir & Jae Drago) & Dance Maniacs
items.description: Juke Bounce Work cofounders DJ Noir and Jae Drago are in fine form on this episode of their Dublab show, blazing through killer edits, footwork and Jersey and Baltimore club. There's also a guest set from Dance Maniacs—the trio of Oak City Slums, Avi Loud and Lian.o—in the second hour.

items.text: Doc Sleep - Birds (in my mind anyway)
items.label: Tartelet Records
items.description:
A gorgeous collection of ambient techno and downtempo IDM from Jacktone's cofounder.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Kynant Records
items.description:
A welcome return from Tikiman, and the most complete insight into Paul St. Hilaire's singular take on dub we've heard yet.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Astounding, progressive soul music from an artist with a wonderful voice and a keen grasp of rhythm.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Deeptrax Records
items.description:
Eight icy-cool slabs of house and techno from one of the US's most inventive producers, who takes something of a back-to-basics turn here.

Listen:
Bandcamp / SoundCloud

items.label: Live From Earth Klub
items.description:
An alternately frightening and snotty blast of curdled rage and humour that sounds like a really good party gone off the rails.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Planet Mu
items.description:
The Detroit producer's debut album rekindles Planet Mu's '00s character with its hodgepodge of fast-paced styles and unruly energy.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: PAN
items.description:
Using ideas from techno, EBM, gqom and hard drum, Tzusing probes cultural alienation and issues of identity with his trademark razor-sharp club music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: XL Recordings
items.description:
Yaeji's second LP comes to terms with anger and resentment she had suppressed as a child, expressing it through bright and often vulnerable trip-hop, drum & bass and indie rock.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Kranky
items.description:
Tim Hecker returns to solo ambient music with an album that rails against a positive-vibes-only ideology and focuses on the mundanity and chaos of everyday life.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Cracki Records
items.description:
Lighthearted but seriously groovy Italo-infused techno from Voiski and Eliott Litrowski.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Kulør
items.description:
Courtesy continues her exploration of what she calls "ambient trance," where, without percussion, she emphasises the moodier elements of trance in its mid-to-high ranges.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: PC Music
items.description:
PC Music's latest signing makes music that is propulsive but dainty, like listening to an Armin van Buuren track coming out of a hand-cranked music box.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Planet Euphorique
items.description:
Dubsteppy bass science meets trance euphoria on D. Tiffany's unstoppable Planet Euphorique label.     

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Time Is Now Records
items.description:
Introspekt offers a masterclass at 140 BPM, from sultry 2-step to vintage grime—it's hard to believe she hails from LA and not London.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Livity Sound
items.description:
Peverelist returns with what he does best: quietly brilliant broken techno, and this time, a little house, too.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Rekids
items.description:
The Detroit legend's Rekids EP captures his two sides—the rowdy and the deep—and brings them together into something party-starting.   

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify

items.label: Marginal Returns
items.description:
A lowkey hero of the underground's long-awaited debut is a little bit cathartic and a little bit creepy—but all about the funk.

Listen:
SoundCloud

items.text: Pretty Girl - One Night, One Time
items.label: Steel City Dance Discs
items.description:
Bubbly, effervescent crossover dance jams from a star in the making.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple Music

items.label: Animalia
items.description:
The four psy-laced jams on this new EP are a robust representation of cutting-edge sounds from Australia's thriving doof scene. 

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: HE.SHE.THEY. RECORDS
items.description:
No-nonsense acid house with a brawny techno backbone.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple Music

items.label: Karim Olen Ash
items.description: The Pep Rally cofounder takes over Chippy Nonstop's Rinse FM show for two hours of skippy house, garage and club mayhem.

items.label: Ani Phoebe
items.description:
<

Hong Kong-based DJ Ani Phoebe pulls out serious sass from her seemingly bottomless record bags for Vietnam's Mogra Radio, with 56 minutes of Balearic, Italo disco and Brasilian boogie.

items.label: Helena Hauff
items.description: Helena Hauff is a very different kind of big-room techno and electro DJ. Get a taste for what sets her apart in this hour-long mix for Amelie Lens's EXHALE Radio.

items.label: Nick Höppner
items.description: On his latest Refuge Worldwide show, Nick Höppner digs into his bag of UK garage records old and new for an hour of pure shuffle and swing.

items.label: Thomas Bangalter
items.description: Daft Punk member Thomas Bangalter, fresh off the release of his new solo classical album, shares some of his influences and inspirations on this NTS Radio session.

items.label: Bashkka
items.description: Bashkka, a resident at Munich club Blitz, reps her hometown endlessly, but her long-time admiration for New York house music shines in this mix, which is equal parts retro, futuristic, funky and trippy.

items.label: Devoye
items.description: New York DJ Devoye delivers an ultra-deep mix for Juanita's, full of massaging basslines, killer organ riffs and husky vocal samples.

items.label: Merve
items.description: This excellent Daisychain mix from the Berlin-based, Melbourne DJ Merve is full of gurgly synths and boinging rhythms, touching on old-school techno and trance with a decidedly modern approach.

items.label: Sassmouth
items.description: Sassmouth has been wowing crowds in Chicago and San Francisco for years now, and more and more recently, around the US, too. Get to know her funky, old-school-leaning house sound with this mix for Seattle queer party Bottom Forty.

items.label: DJ Babatr
items.description: Venezuela's DJ Babatr pioneered raptor house back in the late '90s. It still sounds fresh today, and the Caracas DJ laid down a session of zippy, bouncy, often raucous grooves on NTS last week. Get to know these sounds, because you'll be hearing a lot more about Babatr this year.

items.text: Yves Tumor - Praise A Lord Who Chews But Which Does Not Consume
items.label: Warp Records
items.description:
An ecstatically religious exploration of love and desire through excellent, electronica-infused '90s alt-rock songwriting.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Self Released
items.description:
Retro hardgroove techno made with flair and finesse by one of Mexico's rising dance music stars.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Tresor
items.description:
The UK techno juggernaut taps into the power of live improvisation for one of his best albums ever.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Rabid Records
items.description:
The Knife cofounder Karin Dreijer zeroes in on sex and desire on their captivating third—and best—album.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Interdimensional Transmissions
items.description:
The techno and electro on Erika's second solo LP is a masterful blend of icy austerity and emotional warmth.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music

items.label: Eglo Records
items.description:
Chunky transcends  his roots in the city's bass music scene, deconstructing grime and rap rhythms and laying down pensive, personal lyrics.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Avenue 66
items.description:

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Rvng Intl.
items.description:
An interzone where fragments of techno-pop, video game music and minimalist composition coalesce into a joyful sense of freedom.

Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Ghostly International
items.description:
The kind of woozy, pretty electronic music you might hear in your head while wistfully daydreaming of rave days past.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Mute Records
items.description:
Four tracks of elegant, sometimes fragile techno written in the key of wonder. 

Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Morph Tracks
items.description:
Inventive hard drum club music that collects ideas and rhythms from across the African diaspora and forms them into fierce new shapes.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: MINDHELMET
items.description:
Six tracks of bespoke, Truly Madly-approved tech house adorned with touches of Midwest techno and UK garage.     

Listen:
SoundCloud

items.label: Smallville Records

One of dance music's grooviest producers delivers the goods on her Smallville debut.

One of those rare house bombs that you could unleash with confidence at your cousin's wedding or a summer festival stage and send both crowds into a frenzy.

The Helsinki producer's newest cut is like looking through a kaleidoscope and seeing jungle refracted eight times at once.

items.description:
A year after he deleted his discography from the internet, the rising techno prodigy returns with infectious minimal techno and house.

items.label: fabric Originals
items.description:
A UK team-up of epic (and speedy) proportions.

Listen:

items.label: Classic Music Company
items.description:
Robert and Lyric Hood have gospel techno down to a science, and the formula still sounds great on their latest EP.

Listen:

items.label: Club Romantico
items.description:
Sexy and occasionally intimidating reggaeton dance fusion.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Moxie
items.description: Here's Moxie in session for beloved Japanese festival Rainbow Disco Club. It's got all the bits you'd expect from the UK DJ, namely uplifting house, some weirdo leftfield jams, a hint of electro and what she says are "a few exclusives."

items.label: Marcia Carr
items.description: If you haven't seen London DJ Marcia Carr at gigs like Your Love at Panorama Bar or her own GirlzBLike party, here's a way to get to know her and her vintage, disco- and house-leaning sound.

items.label: Nastya Vogan
items.description: Ukrainian DJ Nastya Vogan shows off a heavy but complex techno sound in this HÖR session.

items.label: Ogazón
items.description: This 95-minute mix, the ninth edition in a series run by popular Berlin party Multisex, shows what rising DJ Ogazón is all about: funk, flair and bags of groove.

items.label: BIIA
items.description:
>

Portugal DJ BIIA goes full-on for this The Brvtalist mix, featuring an hour of intense, poundering techno that borders on everything from old-school rave to hardstyle.

items.label: Carly Zeng
items.description: This DJ set recording from Carly Zeng is a wonderful blend of uplifting house music and more obscure sounds. Or, as Berlin club Sameheads describes it, "All kinds of good s**t in here—right on the money for the Sameheads sound."

items.label: Deena Abdelwahed
items.description: This recording from Crete's Nature Loves Courage festival last year captures Deena Abdelwahed at her peak: energetic, rhythmically complex club music with no regard for genre and hints of Arab music throughout.

items.label: Suze Ijó
items.description: Rotterdam DJ Suze Ijó works at the famous Clone record store, and she's a consummate collector, stringing together deep, soulful, often vocal house records, as shown in this sumptuous Dekmantel Podcast.

items.label: YL HOOI
items.description: A lot of DJs are "eclectic," sure, but few are as wide-ranging as YL HOOI, whose latest NTS Radio session features everything from bizarro techno and bedroom pop to screeching weirdo metal.

items.label: SHERELLE & I. JORDAN
items.description: SHERELLE and I. JORDAN recently went on tour together, and this Crack recording live from FOLD in London exemplifies the uptempo magic they can whip up together, egging each other on and getting closer and closer to some kind of ecstasy.

items.label: Live From Earth Klub
items.description:
A techno guided meditation that draws parallels with the escapism and introspection of the dance floor.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Career-best breakbeats, edits and thrilling jungle from a remarkably consistent producer.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Tresor
items.description:
Tresor reissues a 2001 album of soulful techno and hardgroove from an unsung hero of the Japanese underground.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Nous'klaer Audio
items.description:
The Dutch artist loops samples of his friends and loved ones into music that highlights the beauty of the human voice and the connections it can create.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Warp Records
items.description:
Kelela returns with her usual seductive lyricism and vocal prowess, this time over quiet, aquatic beats.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Workshop

Kassem Mosse steps out from the shadows on his first solo release in six years with two discs of loopy and kaleidoscopic club music. 

Listen:

items.description:
Intensely emotional, neoclassical darkwave from an under-the-radar producer in China.

Hessle Audio taps one of the most exciting producers in club music for a match made in heaven, combining Jordanian musical traditions with leftfield UK techno.

The Georgian composer makes a dreamy ambient EP based around an Eartha Kitt interview.

The enigmatic UK duo take a leap into the uncanny valley on their new EP of strange, sometimes uncomfortable club jams.

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Brilliant, sometimes raw party tunes from one of US house music's leading lights.

Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.text: Deep South Black History Month Podcast 112
items.label: Alexis Curshé
items.description: A lovely Black History Month special that focuses on the past and present of Black house music.

items.label: Introspekt
items.description: Shuffle and swing from Los Angeles's UK garage queen.

items.label: Teki Latex
items.description: This set catches the Parisian DJ at his most techno, though it's still versatile, vibrant and, of course, played with absolute mastery of the decks. (Also, there's a welcome re-airing of Breach's "Fatherless.")

items.label: Afriqua
items.description: Afriqua highlights "lovemaking music" on this Valentine's Day-themed session called "Afriqua Is For Lovers," featuring tracks from the likes of Barry White, Donell Jones, Babyface and even Frank Zappa.

items.label: Di Linh

It's an eye-and-ear-opening mix of new originals and other selections by the stellar Los Angeles producer.

items.description: Vladimir Ivkovic live at Dekmantel Selectors. Enough said.

They said it was "one of those rare and special days when everyone—the dancers, the festival staff, the bartenders and the DJs—were all locked into one continuous groove and sharing a moment in time."

items.description: Dekmantel has shared the usual trove of recordings from their 2022 edition. This one features Yu Su in the party-rocking mode she's been mastering recently—effortlessly fun, groovy and ecstatic.

items.description: New York DJ Love Letters put together an enlightening mix of tracks from '90s Chicago producer L.A. Williams—who ran the Chisel label—featuring plenty of obscure aliases and records long out of print.

items.description:

Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

Epic synth odysseys are infused with human warmth and emo songwriting on this bold new record from the Italian maestro.

items.description:
The experimental artist pens another immersive techno love letter to Lagos, enriched with field recordings that evoke the fast-beating heart of the city.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify
