Schacke homes in on the cartoonish side of techno while keeping the detail, careful pacing and sound design that defines the genre perfectly intact.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Oath
items.description:
It's hard to describe what makes "Sunswell" so perfect—it's just the effortless glide, the way the melodies subtly bend and twirl, the feeling that it could go on forever and never get boring.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Frizner Electric
items.description:
Classic, elegant and sumptuous vocal house from a Detroit rising star.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: Skin On Skin - Burn Dem Bridges
items.label: FFRR
items.description:
The hotly-tipped producer blends hard-hitting techno with UK drill to fiery effect.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Magic City
items.description:
These two tracks take Miami bass as the foundation for glossy but minimalist club music, with the sense of humour and dance floor abandon that makes Jubilee such a vital artist.

Listen: Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Deaf Test
items.description:
Ploy's hit rate is almost absurdly high, and his latest EP features more topsy-turvy UK techno and a veritable new anthem in "Stinky."

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: X-Kalay
items.description:
Propulsive trance with deep, craggy textures to get lost in.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Fixed Rhythms
items.description:
Twisting and turning while staying resolutely on techno's straight and fast path, this is one of those records to reach for when you want something to make your crowd go a little wonky.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: Beyoncé - BREAK MY SOUL (Nita Aviance Club Mix)
items.label: Columbia Records
items.description:
Bey dives deeper into underground house music territory with help from one half of The Carry Nation.

Listen: Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: VOITAX
items.description:
Punk-infused electro and techno served with both a snarl and a smile.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud



https://ra.co/reviews/35032

items.text: Joey Mercedes, Brandon Markell Holmes & Dee Diggs - It Goes On (At The Afterparty)
items.label: Toucan Sounds
items.description: Dee Diggs jumps on a remix of a soulful vocal cut that highlights the sound of New York house both then and now.

items.label: Kerrie
items.description: Irish-born, Manchester-based DJ Kerrie's considerable talents are on full show in this Reclaim Your City mix, which features her usual blend of larger-than-life kick drums, funky grooves and occasional electro detours.

items.label: Sasha
items.description: The Glade Area at Glastonbury Festival is all about paying homage to UK dance music's legends and pioneers. This hybrid set, recorded live in June, shows Sasha in his element.

items.label: Nina Sol
items.description: Get to know Oakland DJ Nina Sol with this effortlessly groovy deep house mix for Fault Radio. It's a great pairing with your morning coffee.

items.label: Krysko
items.description:
<

Matthew Krysko, a resident at Manchester's Warehouse Project, shows off for another residency at a beach bar in Ibiza with five hours of smooth funk, soul, disco and more.

items.label: Angel D'lite
items.description: This Rinse FM session from Angel D'lite is everything good about UK rave music new and old: jittery drums, helium-voice vocal samples and heart-in-mouth breakdowns.

items.label: TAAHLIAH
items.description: DJ TAAHLIAH could easily enter the pantheon of legendary, career-making Boiler Room sets, with an infectious, constantly rising energy and an engaged crowd, culminating in a bonkers edit of Robyn's "Dancing On My Own."

items.label: Regal86
items.description: Monterrey's Regal86 is one of those names that seems to be everywhere recently, and for good reason—his grasp on techno is keen, fast and sexy.

items.label: Analog Soul
items.description: "House, Detroit techno, acid, jazz, downtempo" are some of the genre tags that New York duo Analog Soul use for their latest Lot Radio session. This gives you an idea of what two expect—two hours of elegance and excellence.

items.label: Yazzus
items.description: As Dekmantel says in the text for the new mix from UK DJ Yazzus, "everything is turned up to 11." That's about as best as we could put it—this is a high-speed race through jungle, footwork and rave music.

items.label: Hannah D
items.description:
<

Recorded live at Sub Club Melbourne, this is technically an opening set, but it's far from slow, focusing on the power of percussive loops and twitchy grooves from tech house to trance.

items.text: Black Rave Culture - Black Rave Culture Vol 2
items.label: Black Rave Culture Records
items.description:
Three DC producers make jungle, house and techno that shows the true breadth and power of Black American electronic music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Ron Trent presents WARM - What Do The Stars Say To You
items.label: Night Time Stories
items.description:
With a cast of guests and plush live instrumentation, Ron Trent makes something close to his masterpiece, blurring the lines between house music and chill-out.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Heavenly Recordings
items.description:
The long-time DJ and radio host redefines what Balearic is and can be on this beautiful, sometimes eye-opening compilation.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Hyperdub
items.description:
An imaginary soundtrack to a video game about Scottish space colonization—and one part of a larger multimedia piece—features some of Kode9's funkiest, most innovative rhythms yet.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music

items.label: Leaving Records
items.description:
A virtuosic display of ambient and downtempo musicianship that runs through kosmische, jazz and techno, acknowledging that genres may exist, but often sound best when allowed to bleed into one another.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Slow Life
items.description:
One of the most important house labels of the last decade returns for a victory lap with loopy, colorful beats from the likes of S. Moreira, Primary Perception and Paolo Mosca.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud

items.label: Portraits GRM
items.description:
The much-hyped organist turns to synths and horns on this (relatively) short but overwhelming experiment that calls back to some of the earliest electronic music as well as minimalist heroes.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: Anthony Naples + DJ Python - Air Texture VIII
items.label: Air Texture
items.description:
The ambient compilation series creeps closer to techno with two of its most high-profile curators yet, offering plenty of new artists to discover.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: BLKRTZ
items.description:
In its vision of minimal techno through dub, The Mountain is both comforting and refreshing, and about as epic as its title implies.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Tratratrax
items.description:
Cutting-edge techno incorporating Latin styles like raptor house and tribal guarachero, with excellent remixes from Pearson Sound and Doctor Jeep.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Objekt
items.description:
The first 12-inch in Objekt's legendary self-titled series in five years brings in dancehall influence into his precise, prickly, breathtaking club sound.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Scuffed Recordings
items.description:
Inventive and unorthodox house from the rising Berlin-via-Seattle star.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Anonymous Club
items.description:
Shayne Oliver updates the classic GHE20G0TH1K sound for 2022 with provocative lyrics, killer production and clever guest features.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Voam
items.description:
Arthur Cayzer's solo project hits the dance floor again with a monster of an anthem (the title track) that calls back to the big hyped hits of the 2009 through 2011 era, huge bassline and all.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: Jennifer Loveless – Water Remixes By DJ Fett Burger
items.label: Sex Tags UFO
items.description: DJ Fett Burger adds even more psychedelia to the Australian producer's oceanic jam, with bits of jungle, dub and his usual idiosyncratic touches.

items.label: More Time
items.description:
Lively and percussive, Homecoming is a rowdy homage to the UK, Pakistan and a few places in between.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Klockworks
items.description:
Two generations of Berghain meet in the middle for glorious, galloping techno.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Kilbourne
items.description: Thrilling, super-intense hardcore techno, recorded live at Nature Loves Courage Festival in 2021.

items.label: Lychee & Aaron J
items.description: This is a three-and-a-half-hour recording of New York DJs Lychee and Aaron J opening up the May edition of Nowadays Nonstop, starting out with slow, bubbling grooves and working their way up to atmospheric techno. Basically, it's a masterpiece.

items.label: Tash LC
items.description: Jumping from UK drill to global club sounds from across the African diaspora, this mix from a hotly-tipped UK DJ also includes one hell of a reggae section.

items.label: Martyn
items.description: fabric's impressive new mix series continues with this session from 3024 head Martyn, who keeps things moving with a twitchy, swung and eclectic selection of contemporary dance music, featuring the likes of Jasmine Infiniti, Ehua, Rhyw and Skee Mask.

items.label: Willis Anne
items.description: LAN founder Willis Anne impresses with a Noods Radio session that starts off chilled with some wistful, Detroit-style techno before blasting off into atmospheric jungle.

items.label: Coffintexts
items.description: Trippy techno, acid heat and more from Coffintexts, one of the many—and the best—of Miami's hyped-up new wave of DJs and producers.

items.label: Ila Brugal w/ Logan
items.description: This Keep Hush video captures Ila Brugal and MC Logan in action live at this year's Outlook Festival in the UK, starting off dank and dubby before reaching towards drum & bass and beyond.

items.label: OK Williams
items.description: An NTS session that highlights the energy and joy that underlines the London DJ's sets, with plenty of deep house, pacey techno and a heart-palpitating race to the finish.

items.label: Powder
items.description: This is what Powder had to say about this hour-long mix for Mantissa, which tapped the beloved Japanese DJ for its 250th episode. "I am still dizzy... flying from Tokyo eastbound through Los Angeles and Detroit to London. I see pigeons nesting in the pine trees from the hotel window."

items.label: Lafawndah & Lamin Fofana
items.description: Lafawndah and Lamin Fofana team up for the latest in Bottega Veneta's collaborative monthly NTS Radio show, bringing together tracks from across avant-garde musical history, featuring Xenakis, Oliveros, Miles Davis and even that 800 percent slowed-down Justin Bieber remix from YouTube. (Plus a few tracks of their own.)

items.label: Tobago Tracks
items.description:
Abstract, often breathtaking experimental club music with remarkable sound design and, most importantly, soul.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: D. Tiffany & Roza Terenzi - Edge Of Innocence
items.label: Delicate Records
items.description:
Rushing through trance, drum & bass and downtempo rhythms, the duo's Trans-Europe Express of high-energy dance styles is captivating from beginning to end.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Midnight Shift
items.description:
A mostly ambient DJ set that shows off not only one of Japan's most talented DJs but also the breadth of its electronic music scene.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud

items.label: Hyperdub
items.description:
Through sludgy electronics and fearsome vocals, Moor Mother and DJ Haram offer a damning look at the past and present, with a look to a better future—or at least a different one.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: PAN
items.description:
Marina Herlop's wordless vocal pieces take on a sinister yet colorful edge on this astounding work of voice, piano and electronics.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Novel Sound
items.description:
A downtempo adventure that features some of Levon Vincent's most emotionally gripping music.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.text: Gene On Earth - Time On The Vine
items.label: Limousine Dream
items.description:
Gene On Earth's second album expands the singular producer's cosmos, adding touches of techno and drum & bass to his sun-soaked house.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: ELLES - A Celebration Of The Euphoria Of Life
items.label: Naive
items.description:
On the first album on Violet's Naive label, ELLES implores us to celebrate the ups and downs of life both inside and outside of the club.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: ara
items.description:
Kangding Ray's best album yet is close to IDM in the broadest sense of the term: beautiful and unpredictable tracks sculpted out of dance music elements, but taking completely different forms.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: Lila Tirando a Violeta - Desire Path
items.label: Naafi
items.description:
Inspired partly by a breakthrough in her battle with a chronic illness, this album presents Lila Tirando a Violeta's blend of global club music and pop with stronger melodies, in sharp relief.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: Margaret Dygas - Stars Are Only Light
items.label: Half Baked Records
items.description:
These are minimal tracks that are heady, patient but also filled with humor and drama—if you know where to look and listen. 


Listen:
Soundcloud

items.label: SZNS7N
items.description:
Despite what the title implies, this EP should leave your party better than it started—visceral techno that's much more fire than misfire.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Club Romantico
items.description:
Latin American club music and Dutch bubbling combine on one near explosive EP.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Infinite Machine
items.description:
Aroent's approach is aggressive, globally influenced and stylistically nebulous—three distinguishing sonic traits of the Infinite Machine label.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: Peder Mannerfelt - All In Your Hands
items.label: Peder Mannerfelt
items.description:
Peder Mannerfelt launches his new single series with two versions of one track: one lethal, one lighthearted.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Gilmer Galibard Records
items.description:
Immersive techno that feels like sitting in a mossy forest where everything around you makes unsettling but intriguing noises.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: AD 93
items.description:
DJ Python revives his most delicate alias for a gorgeous homage to friendship.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Soundcloud

items.label: Balkan Vinyl
items.description:
Acid-influenced ghetto house and techno from a New York producer who knows how to get the fundamentals just right.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Sharlese
items.description: Seattle residents already know that Sharlese is one of the best DJs on the West Coast, and this mix for pi pi pi is proof. Enjoy slow but powerful jams, with mixing that moves like a lava flow, overwhelming and all-enveloping.

items.label: Steffi & Virginia
items.description: Frequent collaborators Steffi & Virginia team up for a red hot Is Burning mix full of groovy house and electro.

items.label: Toumba
items.description: Jordan-based DJ and All Centre affiliate Toumba stuns on this mix for Untitled 909, including plenty of his own adventurous leftfield club material.

items.label: Kilopatrah Jones
items.description: Kilopatrah Jones' new Honcho mix is a direct shot of serotonin: an hour of feel-good house that invokes the spirit of togetherness and the unmatchable energy of the genre.

items.label: DJ Nobu
items.description: Here's a rare chance to hear Japanese techno selector extraordinaire DJ Nobu in house mode, recorded live at Tbilisi club Bassiani.

items.label: Adriana Lopez
items.description: Adriana Lopez, one of Colombia's finest exports, shows off her cerebral, rippling style of techno on the second fabric podcast.

items.label: CEM
items.description: Check out the deeper side of Herrensauna cofounder CEM on this captivating mix that puts together slow, bubbling grooves and squishy organic textures.

items.label: TYGAPAW
items.description: This Boiler Room set from New York's TYGAPAW at Primavera Sound is a techno tour de force, with dynamic mixing and approach to the genre that highlights its most vital, elemental qualities.

items.label: FLORE
items.description: POLAAR head FLORE comes correct with her Dekmantel Podcast, offering up an hour-plus of careening, unpredictable, blink-and-you'll-miss-it blends and rhythms.

items.label: Crystallmess
items.description: Paris-based artist Crystallmess offers up 50 minutes of unexpected twists and turns for this Dazed Mix. Strap in for a journey through Ugandan and Congolese rap, grinding electro, classic Chicago house and much more.

items.label: fabric Records
items.description:
The latest fabric mix offers a young, fresh perspective on the timeless power of house music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Captured Tracks
items.description:
A long-lost album of absurdist acid house, R&B and dance pop from the cult German group.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Timedance
items.description:
The Timedance boss zeroes in on texture and structure on this LP of rhythmic experiments.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Opal

items.label: Smalltown Supersound
items.description:
KLO's ethereal techno dissolves into vapor on a gripping, mostly ambient record.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Organ Tapes - 唱着那无人问津的歌谣（Chang Zhe Na Wu Ren Wen Jin De Ge Yao)
items.label: Worldwide Unlimited
items.description:
Emo dream pop informed by everything from indie rock to freak folk to R&B.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Various - Sounds From The Iranian Ultraverse
items.label: Shaytoon Records
items.description:
A collection that shows the fearless, often innovative electronic sounds of the vast Iranian diaspora.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Studio Barnhus
items.description:
Axel Boman looks inward for a double-album of laid-back sonic portraits that showcases all the quirks and homespun sonic touches that make him a one-of-a-kind producer.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Quest for Fire at Apple Music / Luz at Apple Music  / Quest for Fire at Spotify  / Luz at Spotify

items.label: Clarity Recordings - House Anxiety
items.description:
Funk as therapy and catharsis—that's the idea behind Harvey Sutherland's debut album, which mixes sumptuous production with alternately vulnerable and funny lyrics.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Various - The Road Less Travelled Vol.1
items.label: Scenic Route
items.description:
A stunning collection of rap, pop and electronic music that showcases the enduring strength of bedroom productions around the world.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: UIQ
items.description:
The UIQ artist reimagines folk music forms from North Africa and the Persian Gulf as thrilling, groundbreaking dance music. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: Jamal Moss - Thanks 4 The Tracks U Lost
items.label: Modern Love
items.description:
This collection of tracks under Hieroglyphic Being's given name highlights his penchant for both out-of-this-world beauty and gnarly, almost grotesque texture.

Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: Sally C - Big Saldo's Chunker EP 002
items.label: Big Saldo's Chunkers
items.description:
Hip-house heaters that have been lighting up dance floors around the world for years now, finally available on wax.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
The latest in a line of vocal-led dance floor anthems is one of the most iridescent and psychedelic yet.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Collection Disques Durs
items.description:
A rising Montreal artist taps into a rich vein of Canadian Eurodance on a track that's both catchy and haunting.

Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Arjunamusic
items.description:
Imagine how much trippier Ricardo sounds with a classically-trained jazz drummer at his disposal.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
This irresistible EP blends the funky, soulful sounds of Detroit house with the uptempo breeze of the Bronx producer's usual style.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Purple Tape Pedigree
items.description:
The producer for artists like Babyxsosa strikes out on her own with EP of seasick, unpredictable club music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: The Trilogy Tapes
items.description:
Long, winding house jams on The Trilogy Tapes by a Japanese producer who moonlights as a chef and cooking show host.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Macro Hits
items.description:
The new Macro Hits label shows off the sounds of Brazil and Paraguay, and judging from this compilation, their techno, house and electro is cutting-edge, and vital.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Gabriella Vergilov - I Am Here Now
items.label: Symbolism
items.description:
The Bulgarian-born, Copenhagen-based producer makes techno that packs plenty of soul for Ben Sims' Symbolism label.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Rush Hour Music
items.description:
One of Chicago's most revered collectors and selectors shows off vintage-inspired but fresh-sounding takes on techno and electro for this Rush Hour EP.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud

items.label: Circus Company
items.description:
Inspired by pseudo-psychedelic hallucinations, Dan Ghenacia and Tolga Fidan indulge their love of '90s breakbeat.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Perko
items.description: Perko's takeover of the Hessle Audio Rinse FM show is really a star turn, weaving between genres and tempos with plenty of breathers thrown in between the fast tracks, which range from EBM to electro to IDM.

items.label: Ehua
items.description: Ehua's Sónar Festival mix is a real whopper, full of leftfield club sounds. The Italian-Ivorian artist's work on Nervous Horizon has already been impressive, and this mix feels like it could be another milestone.

items.text: Boiler Room x Technics X Dommune
items.label: Marcel Dettmann
items.description: Recorded live from Hard Wax, this session shows off a looser, funkier side of the Berghain resident.

items.label: Tofudj
items.description: Last month Kyiv radio station started the Grains Of Peace project, a series of "calm and peaceful mixes" meant to soothe shattered nerves during Russia's invasion of Ukraine, as well as raising money for charities in the area. Listen back to SZTVO cofounder Tofudj's set, full of loping, hip-hop-ish beats and laid-back melodies.

items.label: Sedef Adasï
items.description: Turkish-born, Berlin based DJ Sedef Adasi is one of Berghain / Panorama Bar's new residents. She kicked off this new mix series from another legendary club—London's fabric—with an hour-long set of pumping house, techno and acid that combines contemporary vibes with a classic touch.

items.label: Verraco
items.description: This HÖR session captures pretty much everything great about Verraco: a blend of techno and electro loaded with bold melodies and detours into swung, broken beats (and a very tiny bottle of Jack Daniels).

items.label: Force Placement
items.description: Force Placement is one of Los Angeles' best techno DJs and a resident at the scrappy, underground party The Black Lodge. On this mix for As You Like It, he shows off his sound: rough, raw and funky electro and techno, featuring his own productions alongside cuts from the likes of The Exaltics, Mono Junk and Gesloten Cirkel.

items.label: Dee Diggs
items.description: Dee Diggs' Dekmantel Podcast shows off the vintage-style house we've come to know from the New York DJ, with a bit of techno and disco thrown in for good measure.

items.label: 4AM NYC
items.description: Recorded in one take, this sensuous, all-vinyl 4AM NYC mix pays tribute to the classic garage house that wafted through stereos across New York, New Jersey, Chicago and Detroit in the '80s and '90s. If a mix could ever be classified as an aphrodisiac, this one would certainly make the list.

items.text: Closing Set At FOLD x FastForward
items.label: Xavier
items.description: This recording from Xavier was the closing set at a Fast Forward event at FOLD last month. What a way to end a party: two-hours of no-holds-barred techno and trance.

items.label: !K7
items.description:
A mix of house music, old and new, that reaffirms the genre's most enduring qualities: soul, unity and hope for a better future.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Leisure System
items.description:
The duo's electro gets colder, spacier and spookier than ever on this career-best album of ice-cold beats.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Soundcloud

items.text: Whatever The Weather - Whatever The Weather
items.label: Ghostly International
items.description:
Loraine James adopts a new alias to explore full musical freedom on her Ghostly debut, featuring everything from emo-inspired vocal tracks to flighty jungle.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Pacific Rhythm
items.description:
Inspired by a stay in beautiful Sea Ranch, California, the Oakland producer's latest album is full of daydreaming house and gorgeous New Age ambient.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Precious Metals
items.description:
Nu-metal, sci-fi and anime inform x/o's songs of metamorphosis and self-examination, where crunchy breakbeats contrast gossamer-light vocals.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: MIRROR ZONE
items.description:
A journey deep into the heart of trance music from a Portland DIY synth star, courtesy of Spekki Webu's new Mirror Zone sub-label.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud

items.label: Telephone Explosion Records
items.description:
What do you do when you find a trunk full of old cassettes in a borrowed car? Make one of the year's most charming and eccentric house records out of them.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Minimal Detroit Audio
items.description:
The Juju & Jordash member's long-awaited debut album is a sprawling and career-defining trip through Detroit techno, jazz and ambient.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music

items.label: Modern Love
items.description:
Unearthly ambient music made from processed samples of ancient Mayan instruments.

Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: 30D Records
items.description:
Half techno, half ambient, Other Dimensions is one of the Detroit producer's most unforgiving but absorbing records, reaching darker depths than ever before.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Kulør
items.description:
The "fast techno" DJ slows down on her first-ever EP, where she uses her acquired knowledge of tension and release to make captivating ambient music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Tresor
items.description:
A reverent love letter to Detroit techno and electro injected with so much personality that it never feels like pastiche.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Shall Not Fade
items.description:
The Johannesbug artist ponders house music's relationship with its origins on an EP that probes the genre's past, present and future.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: NAFF
items.description:
An uncommonly strong remix EP that features striking turns from Donato Dozzy, Aurora Halal, Bambounou and DJ Python, who all put gentle but remarkable touches on Priori's trance-infused techno.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Aquarian - Mutations I: Death, Taxes & Hanger
items.label: Dekmantel UFO
items.description:
A wild ride through drum & bass, IDM and experimental club music from one of Berlin's most creative producers.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Hyperdub
items.description:
Footwork as colorful and playful as the video games that describe it, and an EP that puts Hyperdub back on the map as one of the most important outposts for the genre.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Radiant Love
items.description:
In her own words, the Montreal producer tries to capture "that lezzie energy, that horse energy" with big BPMs and bigger melodies on her latest trance-inspired EP.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music

items.label: Floorgasm
items.description:
With larger-than-life reworks from VTSS, TYGAPAW, D.Dan and more—plus a new LSDXOXO original—this is simply one of the biggest techno records of the year.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Planet Mu
items.description:
Following on from last year's anguished Painful Enlightenment, Jana Rush amps up both the playfulness and dread of her one-of-a-kind take on footwork.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: Physical Therapy - Teardrops On My Garage
items.label: Allergy Season
items.description:
Sample-heavy UK garage that highlights what Physical Therapy calls his own twee tendencies, full of big emotions and tender heartbreak.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Naty Seres
items.description: Naty Seres is one of the more recently appointed Berghain residents, and she brings a different vibe to that storied dance floor, as this mix for Spandau20 illustrates—full of breaks, dubby basslines and other UK-inspired touches.

items.label: Ethel
items.description: Fitzroy and Club der Visionäre regular Ethel appears on DJ Tjizza and Shaque's Mood Waves series with a mix that sways and tumbles through electro, breakbeat, techno and house.

items.label: Frank & Tony
items.description: The reunited Frank & Tony—Francis Harris and Anthony Collins—were the guests on Louise Chen's NTS Radio show this month, offering up over an hour of unreleased originals. You know what to expect: some of the most sumptuous, atmospheric and beautiful deep house around.

items.label: DJ SWISHA
items.description: A 420-themed mix from Juanita's NYC—if you know, you know—full of bangers with a slightly stoned, laid-back quality, even at house or jungle tempo. In the words of SWISHA, "the only prompt I gave myself was 'what do I want to listen to on 420?'"

items.label: Different Shades
items.description: Melbourne's Different Shades hops on Animalia's Animix series with a remarkable hour of cross-genre mixing across high tempos, from halftime drum & bass to electro, jungle and trance.

items.label: Robotron
items.description: Robotron has blessed Trushmix with a two-hour set of all-originals, ranging from electro to techno to house, ahead of the release of his debut album on SJ Tequilla's Shot Of T label.

items.label: KYRUH & Stephen Disario
items.description: Stephen Disario is the latest resident at Los Angeles's WORK parties, and this mix makes a great introduction to his sound, which is heavy and deep, full of arresting details and careful mixing.

items.label: Ben UFO & Four Tet
items.description: A Rinse FM team-up from Ben UFO and Four Tet leads to casual brilliance—two hours of quirked-up bangers and world-class DJing.

items.label: DJ Netburner
items.description: Naarm (Melbourne)'s DJ Netburner has put together a rollicking mix for Mantissa—an hour-plus collection of trippy, often catchy tech house with lots of incredible basslines.

items.label: Apt Pupil (Midland)
items.description: "I was going through some of the first sets I recorded in 2006-2008 after a friend sent them to me," Midland posted on SoundCloud. "This was the sound I was playing in Leeds at parties like Sub Dub / Momentum / Metropolis / Central Beatz and every week on Frequency FM :) I thought it would be nice to share one."

items.text: Leon Vynehall - fabric presents Leon Vynehall
items.label: fabric Records
items.description:
Over the course of these 77 minutes, Vynehall moves from emo rap to classic dub techno to colossal drumfunk and Portuguese batida, and makes it all sound effortless. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Incienso
items.description:
Eerie and beautiful IDM inspired by the Kansas artist's longtime obsession with cars.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Eiko Ishibashi - Drive My Car Original Soundtrack
items.label: Newhere Music
items.description:
Piano, brushed drums and strings become the foundation for this uncommonly evocative score, made for one of the year's most intriguing (and acclaimed) films.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Pleasure Club
items.description:
The London producer pays homage to British dance music through this funky and minimalist collection of tech house, garage and trip-hop. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud

items.label: Rádio Quantica
items.description:
Violet's sometimes jungly, sometimes ambient album is a symphony for everyday tasks like reading, taking the bus and cleaning the house.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: TONE - So I Can See You
items.label: Rhythm Section International
items.description:
Post-punk, calypso and ska meet on this dreamlike album written about the birth of the artist's child, veering between anxiety and hope and full of biting lyrics.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Other People / Unsound
items.description:
Led by Nicolás Jaar, this group piece, featuring the likes of Juliana Huxtable and Senyawa, plays with perceptions of repetition and time for a truly unreal hour of music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: DJ Lag - Meeting With The King
items.label: Ice Drop
items.description:
The king of gqom brings together different corners of South African dance music on his show-stopping debut album, playing around with amapiano and reinventing the genre that he made famous in the first place.

Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Kscope
items.description:
Using late founder Edgar Froese's sketches as a base, the pioneering German band has made one of its best albums ever, four decades into its career—true space music.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Urvakan
items.description:
This compilation put together by Armenian festival Urvakan highlights shared cultural history across Central Asia and Eastern Europe, through ambient music and sound art that explores the meaning of memory.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple Music

items.label: Bambe
items.description:
A one-of-a-kind debut EP of trippy, hypnotic techno made for dancing and inspired by dancing.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Soundcloud

items.label: HIJINXX
items.description:
Nia Archives shows reverence for Black British music's past while blazing a trail for its future on this thrilling EP that infuses R&B with jungle and jazz.


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Radical New Theory
items.description:
Mixing together elements of dubstep, trance and garage, LUXE makes glittering hybrids that sound like the future, right now.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Hajj – Drag Me Into The Void
items.label: Youth
items.description:
The emo vocal-sample anthem we need for this year.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Youtube

items.label: Sonic Groove
items.description:
Sometimes the title just says it all. This is Dasha Rush at her most intense and unforgiving. She even sings on one track, the EBM-baiting "El Kinky," which is worth the price of admission alone.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Looking For Trouble
items.description:
"Metaphysical" almost sounds like if the Shut Up And Dance crew emerged cryogenically frozen in 2022 and tried to make contemporary techno—it's brash, funky and tonnes-heavy.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Sportify / Apple Music  / Youtube

items.text: DJ Nigga Fox - Música da Terra
items.label: Principe
items.description:
Lisbon's master manipulator of rhythm gives his audience room to breathe with bright, airy moments nestled amongst his usual intricate web of percussion.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: YCO
items.description:
Henzo touches on old wobblecore with this alternately jaw-dropping and hilarious EP that also boasts an incredible remix from Manuka Honey and Florentino.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: n goes to infinity
items.description:
Atlanta new-rave young gun Nikki Nair kick-starts his own label with a single that feels like a rickety wooden rollercoaster, sending acid lines down a rhythm that careens between uptempo and halftime.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple Music  / Youtube

items.label: Hinge Finger
items.description:
Where '90s techstep meets 2022 post-dubstep garage.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple Music  / Youtube

items.label: C.FRIM
items.description: Australian DJ C.FRIM's Boiler Room x Sugar Mountain set answers the question: how much bassweight can you pack into one hour? It's a tour de force of creative club music and impeccable mixing, the kind of set you'll return to again and again.

items.label: more eaze
items.description: Ambient storytelling from more eaze, who has put together an alternately gorgeous and haunting mix for c-.

items.label: ADAB
items.description: ADAB's Dekmantel mix is a good encapsulation of what they do best as a DJ: weightless yet bass-heavy grooves where dub, jungle, house and other genres of club music all melt together into something unique.

items.label: Robert Bergman
items.description: There is plenty of jacking Chicago house, swirling acid and other old-school goodies in this mix from Dutch DJ (and one-time Rush Hour affiliate) Robert Bergman, recorded live at Amsterdam's HEAT.

items.label: Anetha
items.description: Anetha's latest mix, for Lobster Theremin, keeps up the pace and energy, but highlights lighter, more nimble sounds than just tonnes-heavy techno—though you still get some of that, too.

items.label: Kikelomo & Courtesy
items.description:
<

Though Courtesy's upcoming debut EP showcases a more ambient sound, this NTS mix is closer to what you'd expect from her, a perfectly blended mix of house, techno, trance and electro, all sleek, shiny and overflowing with melody.

items.label: KYRUH & WTCHCRFT
items.description: New York duo KYRUH & WTCHCRFT recently opened for DJ Stingray 313 at BASEMENT in Queens. "Our ten years of friendship was poured into this performance," they said on SoundCloud.

items.label: Rosa Pistola
items.description: This edition of Rosa Pistola's Radio Super show on NTS highlights some of the women who have helped push and define reggaeton over the years—an equally eye-opening and hip-shaking mix.

items.label: Uncle Dugs
items.description: Uncle Dugs presented a tribute show to the legendary MC Skibadee, who recently passed away. The emotional broadcast includes many friends and colleagues dropping by the studio to pay their respects.

items.label: Abena
items.description: This FACT mix from Abena was inspired by some of their recent warm-up sets, and it's a masterclass in the form: wobbly, wiggly, bass-heavy and gradually increasing in intensity while keeping everything at a tantalizing simmer.

items.label: Incienso
items.description:
Ten immersive vignettes of techno, ambient and IDM, inspired by the Kansas artist's love of cars.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Palto Flats
items.description:
A lost and fascinating synth pop relic from the mind behind Japanese band Mariah. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Circus Company
items.description:
Another deep—and deeply affecting—concept album from the South African maestro, this time focusing on identity, sentience and belonging.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Breaka Recordings
items.description:
Touching on techno, UK funky and kuduro, Breaka's debut LP blends bass science with pop flourishes.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Six Shooter
items.description:
Tanya Tagaq confronts Canada's dark history with the most gripping and powerful music of her career, blending unsettling electronics with Inuit throat singing and raspy yells.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: DDS
items.description:
Love Of Plastic is the easiest Shinichi Atobe album to play for people, and the one whose tracks will probably show up in the most DJ sets, though it still holds plenty of dubby techno surprises.

Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify / SoundCloud

items.label: Samurai Music
items.description:
Diabolical drum & bass from the Samurai Records mainstay, who carefully blends in gleams of techno into his pitch black sound world.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Ghostly International
items.description:
A rich, sometimes spiritual album that ranges from New Age-influenced downtempo to '90s New York house.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Ratskin Records
items.description:
Grief, catharsis and healing define this wrenching part-ambient, part-noise, part-techno LP from the Oakland musician.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify

items.text: Patricia Wolf - I'll Look For You In Others
items.label: Past Inside The Present
items.description:
A stunning debut album from an American ambient rising star, processing grief through various stages of sorrow and acceptance.

Listen:
Bandcamp / SoundCloud / Spotify

items.label: Tijolo Records
items.description:
Dark electro, baile funk and techno come together on this incredible EP, inspired by the looming towers and shadows of São Paulo and its suburbs.

Listen:
Bandcamp / SoundCloud

items.label: HIJINXX
items.description:
Nia Archives' blend of jungle and R&B remains unmissable on this newest cut, which mixes vulnerability with buoyant guitar loops and breakbeats.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Mainframe Audio
items.description:
Another 2011-referencing post-dubstep anthem, another impossible vocal hook, another track you'll be hearing everywhere all year long—for good reason.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Limousine Dream
items.description:
The restless French upstart continues his quest of making the bounciest tech house imaginable. 

Listen:
SoundCloud

items.label: Phantasy Sound
items.description:
Cromby's biggest record yet blends dark acid with festival-ready melodies, and features a heavy Head High remix to boot.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Ilian Tape
items.description:
Explosive techno and basswise club music on a much-anticipated debut EP.

Listen:
Bandcamp / SoundCloud

items.label: Don't
items.description:
Stepping, broken techno that counts among the best and most creative music the Serbian producer has ever put out.

Listen:
Bandcamp / SoundCloud

items.label: All Centre
items.description:
Unhinged club bangers that play tricks with tempo, rhythm and genre.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Somewhere between early '00s New York and early '20s, well, everywhere, this EP mixes synth pop, nu disco and R&B to euphoric (and sexy) effect. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: LuckyMe
items.description:
Jacques Greene's most bittersweet record is also one of his heaviest, featuring flighty jungle and glimmers of trance.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / SoundCloud

items.label: Turkana
items.description: This mix from ANTI-MASS cofounder Turkana shows off the frenetic club sounds of East Africa alongside other blazing selections from artists like Swan Meat, Manuka Honey and Gabber Modus Operandi—a stunning vision of hard dance.

items.label: quest?onmarq
items.description: A rollercoaster ride through 20 years of jungle, mixed non-chronologically, blending eras and moods with an expert touch.

items.label: Club Fitness
items.description: Club Fitness's Good Morning, Angels mix for Club Mixtape was inspired by "the feeling of stealth." Think assassins, fast-paced action movies, Kevlar, Tom Ford-era Gucci.

items.label: Scott Zacharias
items.description: This two-hour live recording from No Way Back Streaming From Beyond 2021 highlights everything Scott Zacharias is so good at. In the words of the man himself: "A bit self-indulgent, a bit nostalgic, definitely... rusty." We don't believe him on that last part or, at least, it doesn't sound like it.

items.text: Crack  Black History Month Ambient Special
items.label: A Space For Sound
items.description: Brooklyn DJ, performer and self-described healer A Space For Sound put together a Black History Month ambient special for Crack with tracks from the likes of Laraaji, Nailah Hunter and KMRU.

items.label: Kikelomo & object blue
items.description: Kikelomo, cofounder of new Accra station Oroko Radio, delivers her first show for the platform, leaning hard into jungle and drum & bass.

items.label: RP Boo & SHERELLE
items.description: One of the moments of Unsound 2021 was undoubtedly RP Boo and SHERELLE's exhilarating back-to-back. "I'm still smiling months later, and enjoyed every second of this dynamic duo session," said RP Boo.

items.label: adelina
items.description: Kyiv's Adelina majorly impresses on this Banoffee Pies Banana 'Cast, with a deep and impeccably mixed journey through techno, electro and broken beat.

items.label: Soso Tharpa
items.description: There are some serious heaters in the second half of this Hessle Audio Rinse FM show when Washington DC DJ Soso Tharpa takes over—if you like big basslines and screwfaces, don't skip this one.

items.label: Paramida
items.description: This Paramida session for Phonica highlights not only the Love On The Rocks boss's eclectic and often vintage-leaning tastes, but also her ability to thread together so many sounds from the past—like a history lesson on shuffle.

items.label: Young
items.description:
An exhilarating mixtape full of inspired collaborations that finds healing through frivolity, fun and friendship.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Sea Cucumber
items.description:
A remix album that highlights not only the rude health of Tzusing's corner of club music, but also the originality of his productions that shines through every rework.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
The shape of amapiano to come from one of the genre's most talented and creative artists.


Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: Seven Davis Jr. - I See The Future
items.label: Secret Angels
items.description:
The singer, songwriter and effortlessly funky producer returns with a world-weary but optimistic new LP.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Soundcloud

items.label: Hakuna Kulala
items.description:
Kenya's up-and-coming MCs dazzle on DJ Ichi's fiery mixtape of homemade drill, trap and gengetone. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud

items.label: Psychic Liberation
items.description:
Ruminations on apocalypse and climate disaster with a surprisingly light and engaging touch from a star of South Korea's burgeoning ambient scene.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Ilian Tape
items.description:
Sure, it came out in November, but this illbient-in-2021 sampladelic masterpiece stayed with us all the way through this month.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
The PIttsburgh producer crafts complex techno from a mix of wonder and discomfort.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Idiosyncratic and textural techno from a Portland, Oregon mainstay.

Listen:
Bandcamp

items.label: Bokeh Versions
items.description:
A hybrid approach to Hindustani classical music that uses drone, noise and doom metal to dramatic effect. 


Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Planet Mu
items.description:
More artful, gravity-defying percussion from the precocious and genre-hopping producer, but this time with a techno bent.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Workshop
items.description:
Porn Sword Tobacco returns to straight-up house and techno with a vengeance (and still a few dreamy detours).

Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Incienso
items.description:
Python returns with a new solo album, which glides listeners through gracious, blissed-out melodies and buttery rhythms. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: summerpup
items.description:
Alternately punishing and trancey techno from one of Berlin's best and most thrilling DJs.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: Princess Diana Of Wales - Princess Diana Of Wales
items.label: A Colourful Storm
items.description:
British soundsystem music meets gossamer-thin dream pop.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: PLUR.net
items.description:
The Baltimore-based artist (and fantasy enthusiast) marries hip-hop, jungle and twinkling video game beats on their treacherous mission to sustain love. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: United Identities
items.description:
The newest signing to Carista's United Identities label, Amsterdam-based mayo makes off-kilter techno with a self-built modular, touching on New Beat, EBM and more. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Soundcloud

items.text: Move D - Inside The Freero Dome
items.label: Smallville Records
items.description:
David Moufang's return to Smallville features three patient pieces of understated ambient house inspired by everyone's favorite Welsh festival.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.text: M.I.C. & Nammy Wams - Naoki Urasawa Could Have Written This Shit
items.label: Inane Conversation Music
items.description:
A turbulent stream of consciousness from the self-proclaimed Kate Bush of grime, produced by a South London rising star.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.label: Shaytoon Records
items.description:
Out-of-this-world club music and intriguing avant-garde that blends Iranian influences with retrofuturist impulses.

Listen:
Bandcamp /  Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Jennifer Cardini
items.description: Maybe it's because she's close to home turf, but Jennifer Cardini sounds invigorated and energized on this live recording from Positive Education 2021, where she careens between techno, house, disco and EBM with ease and precision.

items.label: Hamish & Toby
items.description: Hamish & Toby bless Amsterdam crew SlapFunk with a recording of their DJ set at last year's ADE.

items.label: James Bangura
items.description: Washington DC's James Bangura, cofounder of Black Rave Culture, delivers an uplifting, classic-and-modern-at-the-same-time mix of house and techno for XLR8R.

items.label: Amanda Mussi
items.description: São Paulo's Amanda Mussi puts together what we can only describe as a "huge" ambient mix, encompassing doom metal, drone, IDM and more.

items.label: likeholywine
items.description: likeholywine puts out all kinds of mixes (his drum & bass-focused ones are some of our favorites), but this one zeroes in something approaching peak-time, albeit with a soft touch: lots of trancey textures, galloping kicks and catchy melodies.

items.label: TSVI & object blue
items.description: Following their joint EP on Nervous Horizon in 2020, TSVI and object blue played together at Unsound in 2021—two and a half hours of hard, fast and percussive sounds.

items.label: Jon K
items.description: This recording of Jon K at Ormside Projects really comes close to capturing the livewire energy of a good night out, moving from rap to gqom to electro to techno to post-punk and many places in between.

items.label: Hyperaktivist
items.description: The Venezuelan-born, Berlin-based Hyperaktivist makes a star turn in Dion Lee's SITE : SOUND series with an hour of techno that alternates between foreboding and joyous, sometimes both at the same time.

items.label: Fiyahdred
items.description: Fiyahdred, the South London artist responsible for one of 2021's catchiest club cuts, made a brilliant FACT mix featuring two hours of house, amapiano, disco, UK funky and plenty more besides.

items.label: Sekucci
items.description: "Ce zouk du futur," says one comment on this mix from New York DJ Sekucci, from the vital Paris crew La Creole's Rinse France show.

items.label: Avian
items.description:
Techno and dark ambient blend on an incredible, often unsettling release that favours texture over rhythm. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: NAFF
items.description:
The Montreal artist dives deep into the downtempo side of '90s trance and makes pure ear candy out of it.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: MMM
items.description:
Berlin club vets Fiedel and Errorsmith strip their music back to the fundamental parts, showcasing their creative club sound at its most elemental.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: T4T LUV NRG
items.description:
Breakbeats, clipped vocals, harpsichord—on her debut album, Eris Drew takes all the elements of the records she loves most and makes a joyous nine-track celebration out of them.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Psionic
items.description:
Oshana infuses her swung, groovy house with irresistible bits of Italo disco and hip-hop.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Houndstooth
items.description:
Lotic finds her voice on this stunning, vulnerable and emotional tour de force that ranges from ornate balladry to club-informed pop.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Sound Signature
items.description:
Pure, vital house music recorded in the late '80s by the late producer who was a favorite of Theo Parrish.

Listen:
Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.text: The Black Dog - Music For Photographers
items.label: Dust Science Recordings
items.description:
Sheffield's brutalist landscape becomes the inspiration for stately, sometimes eerie ambient and downtempo.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Planet Mu
items.description:
The artist formerly known as Ital takes inspiration from sculpture and microhouse on an LP full of intricate, hypnotic and often surprising beats.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Souncloud

items.label: Kaptcha
items.description:
Lisbon queer collective kaptcha show off the sounds of the future—abrasive, jagged, confrontational, beautiful—on this remarkable compilation that raises money for trans and nonbinary immigrants in the Portuguese capital. 


Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud

items.label: Self-released
items.description:
Uplifting, leftfield soul with a vibrant message and lovely production details, like the rousing synths and chirping birds that make up the backdrop behind Eddington Again's voice.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Timedance
items.description:
Batu does it again with four more tracks that cut, shimmy, swagger and bang in twisted, unexpected ways.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: XL Recordings
items.description:
A 2-step beat, a heavy bassline and an Erika de Casier sample? You had us at the first bar.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify / Soundcloud

items.label: Hyperdub
items.description:
One of the most exciting records on Hyperdub in recent memory fuses gqom, Afro house and UK funky with Fiyahdred's irrepressible personality and catchy vocals.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Soundcloud

items.label: XL Recordings
items.description:
Blawan looks back to his earliest records with this EP of mind-blowing, contorting rhythms and alien sounds.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: House Anxiety
items.description:
Lacan is the unlikely inspiration for one of the year's defining disco house bangers.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Principe
items.description:
Príncipe's breakout star gets loose and limber on this EP that mixes romantic kizomba with the anything-goes sounds of the Lisbon label's earliest records.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Sinderlyn
items.description:
Tama Gucci tells detailed and often funny stories about the ups and downs of a relationship over sprightly, jungle-inspired rhythms.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Peach Discs
items.description:
Peach's long-awaited debut solo EP threads some minimal influences into her groovy, party-rocking sound.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify  / Soundcloud

items.label: Squirrels On Film
items.description:
The Mexican artist makes riveting, acid-influenced post-punk incantations.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Soundcloud

items.label: Objekt
items.description: Objekt going for nine hours at New York's Nowadays. Need we say more?

items.label: Shannen SP
items.description: The NTS and Hyperdub affiliate shows off the smooth and seductive sounds of amapiano on this great live recording from Unsound.

items.label: Pretty Sneaky
items.description: Pretty Sneaky, the mysterious but hotly-tipped leftfield producer, plays all over the map, from Alice Coltrane to Lutto Lento.

items.label: Nikki Nair
items.description: This 70-minute mix of Nikki Nair's own productions, for DJ Mag's Recognise series, is a rollercoaster ride through breakbeat, electro, footwork and more.

items.label: Silvia Kastel
items.description: Initially known for avant-garde explorations, Silvia Kastel has channeled her left-of-center tastes into compelling club sets.

items.label: Josey Rebelle
items.description: Originally released in April, Josey Rebelle's mix for The Trilogy Tapes is now available in all its glory to stream and download via SoundCloud, and it features plenty of weirdo techno, blissful soul and many, many "wow" moments.

items.label: Midland
items.description: The 400th and final Honey Soundsystem Potcast is one for the ages: a three-hour romp from Midland.

items.label: Vivian Koch
items.description: German producer Vivian Koch—who released an album on AD 93 this year—puts together a gorgeous, textural and often blissful ambient set for Ilian Tape's esteemed mix series.

items.label: LIN000
items.description: This mix from LIN000—now revealed to be the work of North Quarter artists FD and Satl—goes from brooding dubstep to tearout drum & bass vibes with poise and grace. It might just be one of the best drum & bass mixes of the year.

items.label: Dee Diggs
items.description: Honcho Campout has been sharing recordings from this year's festival, and Dee Diggs' mix is an easy highlight, focused on what she calls "gay anthems" with plenty of soaring vocal tracks.

items.label: Warp Records
items.description:
A gorgeous exploration of ambient-leaning jazz fusion through horns, modular synth and field recordings from one of Warp's most exciting signings in recent memory.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: Moor Mother - Black Encyclopedia Of The Air
items.label: ANTI-
items.description:
Moor Mother creates an Afrofuturistic soundtrack to the perils of Black life in the pandemic, featuring collaborators from across the African diaspora.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple Music

items.label: Woe to the Septic Heart
items.description:
Shackleton strips his music back to its foundations with no gimmicks or guest stars, and the result is one of the most hypnotic and immersive records in his catalogue.

Listen:
Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

items.text: 박혜진 Park Hye Jin - Before I Die

items.description:
This is 21st-century hip-house at its best, at turns funny, heartbreaking and deeply personal—a coming-of-age parable from a rising star.

Listen:
Bandcamp

A paean to the duo's native Manchester, Honest Labour searches for meaning and place through field recordings, samples and the voices of their collaborators for an ambient album that feels both epic and homespun. 

Listen:
Bandcamp / Spotify / Apple Music

The minimalist composer makes her most dynamic music yet, layering instruments and textures into a hazy reverie that feels brand new.

Listen:
Bandcamp /

items.label: Gloriette Records

Written in the wake of a divorce, Nite Jewel's latest album is both her quietest and loudest, pairing hushed (and often complex) production with gut-wrenchingly direct lyrics.

Bandcamp / Apple Music / Spotify

Bandcamp

Bandcamp

items.label: Slackk
items.description: The Boxed cofounder put together a mix of classics from the party and label of the year, marking its last-ever party which took place in September.

items.description: Equipped with a handful of intricately mixed oddball tracks, the New York-based DJ hands in a mix for Holding Hands that proves why she's one of the best in the city.

items.label: Eddington Again

items.text: Emotional Machine Funk2025 has been defined by the collapse of techno optimism. Where the nascent internet's frontier spirit once pointed to a bright future, today that promise feels sinister, curdled
items.description: Emotional Machine Funk2025 has been defined by the collapse of techno optimism. Where the nascent internet's frontier spirit once pointed to a bright future, today that promise feels sinister, curdled by the "corporate gloom" and data extraction documented in Liz Pelly's excellent book, Mood Machine. The year's most compelling machine funk reflects this irradiated state of distress on a personal and collective level, as well as caution about what our technological destiny truly holds.The electro, techno and slanted IDM we listened to in 2025 went beyond techno pessimism to focus on other knotty concepts, such as grief and loss, provoking visceral gut punches to attain those physical highs. It's music that makes you feel and move, which, if you go back to Detroit techno's history, has always been there. No one told this story better than the Motor City's early pioneers, whose fragile and furious proto-techno output was never blindly optimistic. RA's staff picks of the year pull from this DNA: DJ Bone's The End Of Never, with its muscular electro, stands as the embodiment of Detroit, rooted in a '90s urban reality that focused on interrogating systems of power and decay.These ghosts of past motifs echo through these releases, which are neither hopeful nor nostalgic throwbacks. This is machine music deeply rooted in the turmoil of the present, asserting that the sound of the zeitgeist refuses to be background noise. It's a defiant new link in a chain of creation that speaks to adversity, and it demands that we listen. What does that say about 2025, that artists are trying to produce music that says something through bleeps and bloops again?– Chloe LulaRecord of the YearBlawanSickElixirAfter more than a decade at the forefront of club music, Blawan could easily have settled into legacy act territory, churning out formulaic imitations of past successes from the comfort of the techno assembly line. Instead, on SickElixir, he doubles down on innovation.The album finds the UK artist at his most vulnerable. Themes of grief, trauma and addiction (he recently spoke to Crack about having to leave Berlin after drugs "basically shattered" his life there) are folded into serrated rhythms and monstrous, almost bodily vocal work—even fleeting moments of warmth arrive refracted through a darker lens. The ferocity of his early work remains, yet the melodic smears, fragmented vocal gasps and unexpectedly tender swells reflect an artist intent on expanding his emotional bandwidth. SickElixir sees Blawan turn years of experience into something raw and profound.– Michael LawsonRead the full reviewListen:BandcampRecordsMarie DavidsonCity Of ClownsIn a world shackled by surveillance capitalism, Marie Davidson posits what might be the only true subversion left: satirising this power structure with sexual hedonism run rampant. City Of Clowns brings this madcap concept to life. Thunderous, funky basslines and mind-melting electro synths are helmed by Davidson, who plays the Alexa-like narrator gone rogue, extolling the virtues of data mining with expletives and double entendres. If the machinist future our tech overlords are envisioning is even one tenth as sexy as this, bring on the singularity.– Jake IndianaRead the full reviewListen:BandcampUnspecified EnemiesRomance in the Age of Adaptive FeedbackPart of the enduring magic of '90s Detroit-school techno is how the producers made pieces of hardware sing. Louis Digital isn't from Detroit and it isn't the mid-90s, but you can't tell by listening to Romance in the Age of Adaptive Feedback. Equal parts nostalgic and futuristic, brimming with feeling and assembly-line grooves, the record is a pitch-perfect homage to classic Motor City techno and electro by a true lover of the form.– Henry IvryRead the full reviewListen:BandcampTracksDJ Bone"Deep Inside"On "Deep Inside," DJ Bone pairs his famously surgical drumwork with a simple vocal mantra, a reminder that there's a human pulse driving the circuitry. As the oscillating synths kick in, elastic and almost overcooked, the track feels like a machine learning its purpose, pushed by a human hand that refuses to let the gears lock into place. The way he flares open the mix turns his tight grid into something that emulates a living, breathing organism.– Reid BGRead the full reviewListen:BandcampSandwell District"Hidden"Austere techno brutalism be damned—on End Beginnings highlight, "Hidden," Regis and Function returned to their Sandwell District project with a rounded melodic sound that found its pocket and leaned deep into it. The track's interplay between insistent acid, throbbing mono synth bass and syncopated sub rumble displays a funkiness more readily associated with Motor City titans. "Hidden" evokes the shadowy, emotive pulse of Carl Craig classic "Sandstorms" while giving it the Sandwell District pressure-cooker treatment.– Oli WarwickRead the full reviewListen:BandcampMixLimited NetworkITPS119 LIMITED NETWORKAs Limited Network, Detroit-based artist Max Watts channels the city's lineage, using the TB-303 to connect classic machine funk with its sleek 2020s mutation. His Ilian Tape mix opens with tight 303 sequences: clean resonance peaks, controlled envelopes and a filter sweep that traces a line from forebears like Robert Hood and Jeff Mills. Rather than treat acid as nostalgia, the mix unfolds with curiosity, moving through Drexciya-esque passages and punchy electro workouts. Watts honours Detroit's foundations while showing how the machine-funk blueprint still resonates today.– Bella AquilinaListen:SoundCloudFurther ListeningPolygonia, Wata IgarashiCross PassageListen:BandcampBlack SitesR4Listen:BandcampEhua"Aria"Listen:BandcampBarker"Stochastic Drift"Read the reviewListen:BandcampTraxxThe Definitive Articles of House Music Chapter 6Listen:SoundCloudListen to the Emotional Machine Funk playlistSpotify

items.text: Bass WeightWe should've clocked it when FWD>> and Tempa returned. From late 2024 through 2025, bass weight has been pushed into new places. From Bristol outlet Dimeshift, which continues to lead fresh
items.description: Bass WeightWe should've clocked it when FWD>> and Tempa returned. From late 2024 through 2025, bass weight has been pushed into new places. From Bristol outlet Dimeshift, which continues to lead fresh, first wave-inspired dubstep, to Beatrice M., who released a strong run of their own tunes, as well as issuing music from the likes of Tighe, Old Man Crane and Dangermami via their label, Bait.Across the board, artists increasingly unified the roots of sound system music with their own astute, modern twists, propelled by a more femme-led, internationally reaching school of artists and labels. Introspekt's Moving the Center unlocked a newfound sensuality in dubstep and dark garage; tracks like Mia Koden's "Skank Steady" bottled anticipation for summer with floating keys and a warm bassline; Lauren Duffus's excellent Can's Gone Warm EP served weighty alt-pop, folding in trip-hop and post-dubstep shimmer reminiscent of Kelela's Cut 4 Me. And then Tracey & Riko Dan's "Sex Life" abandoned elegance entirely, taking a thrumming low-end and plonking a pithy hook on top: "All I wanna do is fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck, fuck."Alongside Beatrice M., names like EMA were busy earning much-deserved flowers with standout festival sets, while legends assembled in the form of Mala and dub techno veteran Paul St. Hilaire, who collaborated on "Like It's Always Been," the opening track on St. Hilaire's album. In a year that Timedance and SPE:C turned ten (and Tectonic hit 20), techno-infused bass weight stocks are arguably at an all-time high, and sound system music at large is, in all senses of the word, booming.– Nathan EvansRecord of the YearPaul St. Hilairew/ the ProducersFor Kynant Records' Richard Akingbehin and the voice of dub techno, Paul St. Hilaire, the decision to summon the ghost of Rhythm & Sound's seminal 2003 album, w/ the Artists, was classy yet bold. Would w/ the Producers build on its source material? Or risk living in its shadow? The album's faultless cast of collaborators, including Batu, Shinichi Atobe and Azu Tiwaline, made failure impossible. As a sonic aesthetic, dubwise is flourishing right now, and this LP bottles its power and beauty in myriad tones and tempos, from Mala's orchestral skank on "Like It's Always Been" to the slo-mo psych thump of Aurora Halal & DJ G's "Mary Jane Greenfield." The pièce de résistance is, of course, St. Hilaire himself. He graces every beat with poise and purpose, never overdoing it. As the years roll by, once-mythic musicians can lose touch with their former brilliance. Not this Dominican dub poet.– Carlos HawthornRead the full reviewListen:BandcampRecordsIntrospektMoving The CenterIntrospekt has what you want and what you need. Sound familiar? You might recognise those words from KMA Productions' '96 garage track "Cape Fear," which Introspekt samples on "Subliminate," the final track on her debut album. From the New York-based artist, what we want is something new, fresh and stimulating in a way we've not experienced before. And what we need is dubstep. Introspekt delivers both, making bass-heavy 140 riddims sound smoother and sexier than ever.– Sam DaviesRead the full reviewListen:Bandcampex_libris001 & 002Every time Dave Huismans returns, it's cause for celebration. Just one catch: the lexicon of writers and fans alike falls short in capturing his aversion to fixed form. What exactly is ex_libris? Iridescent, deep electronics, backed by a swirl of percussion and an exceptional attention to textural detail? Rolls right off the tongue. At any rate, this headphone-friendly double drop sums the qualities of his best-known projects—2562's swampy low-end, A Made Up Sound's nonlinear jams—in a teeming soundscape with an almost hydraulic sense of progression. "It has a lot of character," he once told us about his gear, "and that's why I like it." Dave, the feeling's mutual.– Gabriel SzatanListen:BandcampTracksTracey"Sex Life"The anonymous London-based duo knocked everyone out of the park with their self-titled debut. Press play once and you'll be convinced. "Sex Life" is deadly dubstep in classic form, with a searing verse from vaunted MC Riko Dan. But then, there's a twist. "Sex Life" also features surprising interludes of twinkling synths and bubblegum vocal loops with a bedroom pop feel—inflections that add a touch of irreverent internet humour. It's a perfect marriage of neon pop and bass weight—a uniquely 2025 take on dubstep.– Nyshka ChandranListen:BandcampLauren Duffus"N.U.M.T.E."Lauren Duffus's Can's Gone Warm EP is her best work yet. On "N.U.M.T.E," fragile, R&B-inflected vocals float over jittery breakbeats and shadowy synths, recalling the likes of Murlo and MssingNo without ever feeling derivative. The track inhabits the liminal space between the club and the lonely hours after closing, leaving a lingering sense of longing wrapped in mystery. It's exactly the kind of idiosyncratic, emotionally vivid production that marked Duffus as one of the year's most compelling artists.– Fahad AkinsanyaListen:BandcampMixBeatrice M.THE DUBSTEP - TECH HOUSE CONNECTIONIn this NTS Radio entry, Beatrice M. explores the connection between two once maligned genres, dubstep and tech house. Joined by Appleblim, they map the sonic bridge from Bristol to Berlin, zeroing in on the collision point where technoid bass hybrids meet skippy 120-BPM rollers—the juncture where Villalobos can bring low-end into his sets or Shackleton can put steppers onto Perlon. All the greats are there: Margaret Dygas, Sub Basics, Pinch, Zenker Brothers. Skankers, wafters, at the end of the day, don't we all bleed bro?– Rachel Grace AlmeidaListen:SoundCloudFurther ListeningSub BasicsNever Too LateListen:BandcampCarrierRhythm ImmortalListen:SpotifySkepta, Fred again.."Victory Lap feat. items.text: Paul St. Hilairew/ the ProducersFor Kynant Records' Richard Akingbehin and the voice of dub techno, Paul St. Hilaire, the decision to summon the ghost of Rhythm & Sound's seminal 2003 album, w/ the Ar
items.description: Paul St. Hilairew/ the ProducersFor Kynant Records' Richard Akingbehin and the voice of dub techno, Paul St. Hilaire, the decision to summon the ghost of Rhythm & Sound's seminal 2003 album, w/ the Artists, was classy yet bold. Would w/ the Producers build on its source material? Or risk living in its shadow? The album's faultless cast of collaborators, including Batu, Shinichi Atobe and Azu Tiwaline, made failure impossible. As a sonic aesthetic, dubwise is flourishing right now, and this LP bottles its power and beauty in myriad tones and tempos, from Mala's orchestral skank on "Like It's Always Been" to the slo-mo psych thump of Aurora Halal & DJ G's "Mary Jane Greenfield." The pièce de résistance is, of course, St. Hilaire himself. He graces every beat with poise and purpose, never overdoing it. As the years roll by, once-mythic musicians can lose touch with their former brilliance. Not this Dominican dub poet.– Carlos HawthornRead the full reviewListen:Bandcamp

items.text: IntrospektMoving The CenterIntrospekt has what you want and what you need. Sound familiar? You might recognise those words from KMA Productions' '96 garage track "Cape Fear," which Introspekt samples
items.description: IntrospektMoving The CenterIntrospekt has what you want and what you need. Sound familiar? You might recognise those words from KMA Productions' '96 garage track "Cape Fear," which Introspekt samples on "Subliminate," the final track on her debut album. From the New York-based artist, what we want is something new, fresh and stimulating in a way we've not experienced before. And what we need is dubstep. Introspekt delivers both, making bass-heavy 140 riddims sound smoother and sexier than ever.– Sam DaviesRead the full reviewListen:Bandcamp
